1251.content:
Male Coyote it is. Let's get some backstory in here. You weren't always a giant but rather it was a gradual build up.

Roughly a month before the rampage...

You were woken up again by the coughs in the next room over. Sounds like your roommates were awake again. It didn't bother you at all, you knew the younger of the two was always sick, she was born that way. You walked over to the door and decided to check on them like you always did when you heard them awake. You knock at their door and wait.

It creaks open and standing with a tired expression plastered to his face was your best friend since childhood. He was lion with a blue mane and significantly well built. "How's..." you began.

"It's just her cough again." He responds as he rubs his tired eyes. The lion looks back to see his sister had fallen asleep once again. He steps out into the hallway with you and shakes his head as he closes the door. "Darean, you know we can't keep going like this. Without proper medical care, Lissa's only going to get worse."

You gently pat your friend's shoulder. "Korumu, you need to relax. I got something tomorrow, might just pay off. If I'm accepted, we get fifty grand for just getting accepted. And if everything goes well, another fifty grand when everything's done." You say trying to put your friend at ease.

The next morning you had left early to the research lab. The doctor was reviewing your application as his nurse gave you a physical. "Male coyote, about a C for his muscle index. Teeth in excellent shape. Fur color is sandy brown with silver on his head. Starting weight is one twenty-five (125) pounds, starting height is five feet five inches (5'05")." The nurses said as she finished your physical.

The doctor turned to you and set your application to the side. "Physically you're average. Which is just what we were looking for." He explains. He gestures to the nurse. "Make sure his check is ready after this appointment." She nods before leaving the room. You look at the doctor and wait. "Mister Darean, you've read the testing guidelines and what all we will be doing to you, correct?"

"Yes." You reply. With that you see the doctor pull out a bag and withdraw a syringe. He finds a vien and pokes the needle in before emptying the contents into your vien. You wince as he withdraws the needle and patches up your arm.

You leave the office and pick up your check. Over the next few weeks you returned to the office for regular check ups and saw other creatures. Many were larger than you.

One day before the rampage...

You were sitting at the dinner table with Korumu and his younger sister, Lissa. The three of you were having your once a week "family dinner", tonight was chicken and dumplings. You noticed Lissa kept staring at you.

"Something wrong, Lissa?" You asked worried.

"You've gotten taller, like way taller." She comments as she looks away.

Korumu looks you over. "And you've bulked up. Side effects of whatever that application was for?" He asks concerned about your wellbeing.

"Doctor was saying he was testing a new drug that would help increase mass and hopefully help with patients that have lost mass due to medical complications." You replied.

Day of the rampage...

You and Lissa had gone out for a walk while Korumu was at work. The two of you stopped at a park bench for her to rest. You smiled as she had been showing signs of health improvement since you used the money you were getting to pay for treatments for her. In the distance the two of heard the sounds on gunfire and buildings being destroyed.

Lissa flinched, burying her face into your shirt. You held her close but raised an eyebrow as you glanced down. She felt smaller. No. You were experiencing a rapid and sudden growth. Wincing slightly, you pulled away from her not wanting to accidentally crush her. Other folks in the park were pointing and screaming as your size shot up.

"Darean?!" Lissa was taken back as you grew.

You let out a slight growl as your body grew to an impressive size. When you finally stopped growing, you were a colossal sixty feet in height. Your ears twitched as you looked around, you spotted Lissa near your left foot, she was shaking in fear. "Lissa? Hey, it's ok." You say softly as you gently reach down.

You gently pick her up in your padded left paw and brought her up to eye level. She was still shaking, more so in surprise now than fear. "Darean, what's happened?" She asked as she sat on your palm.

Shaking your head, you thought for a moment. "Probably that serum they were testing." As you finish, you felt a sudden pain in your left thigh causing you let out a howl. Glancing to look you see bullets being shot at you. While they didn't cause any harm, they cause irritation. You heard the officers reporting "another one being lose".

You carefully close your hand around Lissa before running off. Unfortunately you ran right into the downtown district of the city. All around was destruction as other giant furries and scalies were destroying everything. You recognized them from the appointments.

You look around finding an out of the way alleyway. Careful you set Lissa down. "Stay here and stay safe. If something happens, yell out for me." You explain.

"What're you---" she begins.

"There's people who need help. Someone's gotta help." You interrupt before running off.

Quickly you rush over and manage to stop it from collapsing. "It seems the serum works albeit a bit too well." The tiger said as he looks at you. "Darean, if you would, meet me at the research facility. You can bring your friends if you'd like. They might want to know all the side effects of that drug."

1251111.content:
As you arrived at the research facility, the three of you were escorted to the back courtyard where the tiger was waiting. He smiled up at you and watched as you gently set your lion friends down.

"I'm glad you came." Dr. Rathmorse said as he greeted you and your friends. He must have seen the look on Korumu's face, causing him to clear his throat and continue. "I'll cut to the chase. The serum was still very experimental, as such we actually have no idea what might happen to you. Most of the others showed increased aggression, and decreases in their cognitive functions. Some actually ate others within the community. While other did some... less appropriate things."

"So you're saying, my friend could randomly snap and go berserk?! That he might suddenly become aggressive and harm others?!" You could hear the outrage in Korumu's voice.

"Korumu," you paused as he looked up at you. You give him a reassuring smile. "it's going to be alright. I mean, I'm still me after all." You say before gently putting your friend's head with your index finger.

Dr. Rathmorse clears his throat again. "While that is the case for the time being, I would like to get some blood samples so that we can study what all this might do. I'd also like to get a MRI, CT and other tests to get a baseline on you at your size."

You agree and soon regret it. Korumu and Lissa were escorted outside and off the property. That was a last you saw of them. Dr. Rathmorse said they were welcomed to visit any time they wished. Days turned to weeks. Weeks into months.

Locked away in a large holding cell, you rarely got to leave it. Only when it was time for new tests and blood work. When you asked, the doctor always told you that it was for your safety and everyone else's as there was no knowing when you might go feral. You would claw small tics into the wall, keeping track of the days.

Month 5, day 25...
You thought about breaking out.

Month 7, day 4...
You had tracked the comings and goings of everyone at the facility.

Month 9, day 10...
Do you jailbreak?

The giant’s fingers grasp you, yanking you up towards his furious face. “I don’t need a lecture on morality, especially from someone small enough to be my lozenge,” he snaps.

“Okay, I’m sorry,” you reply. “I was just saying... It’s not really very good at all to do what you did... Wait, what’s the matter?”

Pyrrhus just about drops you back to the surface of the table, his eyes moistening. “Fuck, I’m terrible. You’re right. It’s just, so many terrible things had been happening to me. My life sucked. So when I got huge, well, I decided to do terrible things. Terrible things I regret now. And when they got me, those army dudes, well, before they knocked me out, they were staying stuff. About what they’d do. To me,” Pyrrhus’ head hits the table, feet away from you. He turns to look at you. “I’m so scared. I really am. I don’t want to be experimented on or killed or whatever they’re gonna do to me,”

“Well,” you finally say. “Maybe...
1421211.title: Company

choices: "Thanks... but I don't want anybody seeing me right now."
14212111.content:
"Maybe... I could get them to move my apartment into here, keep you company a bit." His head seems to suddenly jerk towards you, staring for a moment before he gives a quiet chuckle.

"You? Move in here? You'd want to stick around with a mess like me?” He shook his head a little bit. “Why would you want to do something like that?" His voice seemed more bitter than anything else, but his eyes remained on you as you spoke.

"It's not like I like my job here, you know. I basically got dragged along with you the moment you got here, and it's pretty clear that I'm not important to these guys..." You sigh a little bit, just looking up at him quietly. He seemed to be watching with a bit of an confused expression, but he didn't say a word. "Right, suppose you'll also want to know that... I don't work for these guys. I'm supposed to be an intern at this lab. All I know is, you got dragged in here, and suddenly, the entire place is swarming with military guys."

"Yeah, right." He rolled his eyes quietly, a rather irritated tone in his voice. "Why would they send you in here with me, then? You think they'd trust a random person to... To what, handle me?"

"They don't trust me," You spat out the words with a bit of irritation. You were well aware what Pyrrhus might do to you, but you couldn't hide the bit of annoyance you had towards him by now. "I was only picked to be here because he doesn't want risk anybody important. And since they didn't argue when you just picked me up and took me with you, I think it's pretty clear that I'm worthless to them." Your tone was barely level, and you could feel your voice shaking as you finished. You weren't sure if it was from telling the ferret this, or if it was because you were admitting it to yourself as well.

His expression seemed to relax a little, but his gaze slowly turned down over, his body shifting a little in his chair. "Great. So I'm stuck here, and you're offering to stay even though you want to be here even less than I do." He leaned back, his head tilting against the back of his chair and staring at the ceiling. "The last thing I need is a little guy here guilt tripping me this entire time. I have enough problems on my own. So just scurry away, or whatever."

"Look, I offered to stay because I know what you're going through." He seemed to pause for a moment, before his head moved back down, an eyebrow raised as he looked at you. He gave a small chuckle, and you grunted as you shook your head. "Fine, not the whole 'giant trashing a city' thing. But seeing as this lab's under military control, and I'm not exactly in the best position, myself. Even if I tried to walk out now, they'd probably send me back in here the moment they want something from you. So you can trust me when I say I know things are a mess. I figure... We might as well make the most of this. And I'd rather just get to know you and talk with you and stuff... And from the sounds of it, you... You probably could use someone to talk to as well."

"So... So you actually want to stay? Of your free will and all? You're not scared or anything?" His head leaned in a little closer to you as he turned in his chair, making you freeze up as you see him approach you.

"Are you kidding? I've got a giant ferret next to me, and a full army waiting outside and keeping their eyes on me, and I'm offering to make this a full-time thing. Right now, I'm terrified out of my mind." You swallow a little as you see his eyes close, and take a slow step closer. "B-but... you're just as scared right now, aren't you..."

You stood there in silence for a moment, not knowing what to expect. Neither of you set a word, and as the seconds ticked by, you were starting to worry that he would lose it, or break down, or something. You quietly sat on the table as he kept still.

However, after a minute, you saw his eyes open again. He simply gave a small nod before speaking again. "Yeah... I am. This whole thing is crazy..." His hand pressed down on the table next to you, and you nearly rolled back to avoid it reflexively. "I mean, look at me. One minute I'm getting lunch, and the next thing I know, my head was bursting through the building. After that..." He gave a small grunt as he lifted his hand up, a slight impression left on the table. "Building was in pieces around me." He seemed to be smiling a bit again, and you weren't eager to let him continue on his train of thought. "Felt weird at first, but by the time I got my balance aga-"

"The point is..." You quietly interrupted, and though he still had his grin, his eyes were looking at you again. "Things are weird all around right now. But you... You don't really seem like a bad guy. So... Yeah, I'd like to stay with you... If you're okay with that."

"And you're better than I expected from some lab geek." He spoke rather quietly, his voice speaking with a slight tone of annoyance. "Thanks for the offer." He closed his eyes for a moment, looking like he was uncertain as well. However, it didn't take long before you heard him speak again.
14212111.title: Closer to Understanding

choices: There's a small, human-sized door next to the large one, and it opens for you
No such luck, and you have to crawl through the vents.
142121111.content:
"I'd… appreciate you staying." The mischief seems to have disappeared from his eyes, and his smile looks to be genuinely thankful. Perhaps, you think, the two of you have made some sort of connection. "Just don't forget, Ridge," Pyrrhus continues, pointing a long black finger in your face, "if you start to do any kind of experimenting on me in here, I can always use you as a Q-tip or something." So much for a connection.

"Well, I don't think you'll have to worry about that," you say, your voice cracking slightly. "Don't tell my boss, but in Science I'm a C student, at best."

Pyrrhus chuckles slightly, then stands back up to his full height and starts to pace around the room, leaving you eye level with his waist and giving you a full view of his body for the first time since the two of you were in the back of the truck. Nowhere near as nervous now, you find yourself more able to examine and appreciate the ferret's slender build. His legs are long and toned, and his chest and stomach muscles look tight and firm - he definitely takes good care of himself. If the situation were slightly different...

"So, how do we do this?" His sudden question interrupts your thoughts. "I mean, I doubt the guys out there will let me stomp on over to your house, rip out your bedroom, and carry it back on over here."

"Um, probably not." You think for a moment. "I suppose I could ask them to let me bring in a mattress or a cot and some blankets. I think that's all I'll need, really. I could sleep right here on this table."

"Really?" Pyrrhus bends over to look at you closer. "How will you get up and down here every day?"

"Oh." That thought didn't occur to you. You peer over the edge, noticing for the first time the forty foot drop. "Well, I suppose you could pick me up and place me down each time."

Pyrrhus frowns, his large eyes narrowing, as he brings his muzzle closer to you. "What, so is that all I am to you? A talking ferrety elevator?" You worry for a moment that you've offended him, but then his face suddenly changes to a wide grin, and he exhales deeply, the force of his breath pushing you backward, nearly knocking you over. "I'm just kidding, Ridge. I'm not that easily offended."

You smile, relieved to still be in the ferret's good graces. "Yeah, I knew that," you lie.

"Still, are you sure you don't want to set up on the floor?" He points to the corner of the room opposite the bed.

You consider this for a moment, then shake your head. "I don't think that would be a good idea. No offense, but I don't want to be squished underfoot by a groggy ferret who has just gotten out of bed."

"Point taken," Pyrrhus says, nodding. "Fine. You go out and see if you can get what you need. I'll… wait here, I guess."

He picks you up, holding you a little gentler than before, and sets you back down on the floor by where you came in. It is at this moment that both you and Pyrrhus simultaneously realize your problem.

"Uh," you wonder aloud, staring at the massive door in front of you that is closed and looks to stay that way for the foreseeable future, "how exactly am I gonna get out of here?"
142121111.title: Roommates

choices: "It's a nightmare getting enough supplies and food for him."
"The lab is getting set up for a few experiments for him."
1421211111.content:
“Hm? You say something?" Pyrrhus bent his head down a little bit to try to move closer, his hand cupped to his ear. You shook your head quietly as he leaned in, the sudden movement startling you a little.

You turn back to him, and try to shout at him. "Just trying to figure out how-" He gave his hand a bit of a wave as you shouted, shaking his head a bit.

"No need to yell... Can hear you just fine if you talk. You were muttering, that's all."

You were a little surprised that he could hear you speaking from that distance, but gave a small nod at him. "Yeah... Just wondering how I can get out... I mean, I don't think I'm going to be using your door..." You glance around nearby, your eyes pausing as you see a small section cut out next to it, another smaller door nearby. "Wait... Think there's another door here."

"Hm... I guess they've got a door for you little ones. Makes sense... I doubt my hand would even fit through that..." He seemed to pause a little bit as he glanced to it, before his eyes moved back to you. You started to walk, but his stare unnerved you a little bit.

"I'm not running away, if that's what you're thinking... I said I'd stay." You tried to speak, but he only gave a noncommittal nod in response. You could hear him moving and climbing back into the bed, grunting a bit as he leaned onto one of his hands. However, though you weren't watching, you couldn't help feel Pyrrhus's eyes watching you quietly as you moved. It wasn't like there was anything else for him to do, but it still made you feel a little disconcerted knowing the giant was keeping his eyes on you. And, with the size of the room, it took you longer than you'd like to move to the door. You couldn't help but feel a little relieved when you heard him shifting in his bed, hoping he had turned over and wasn't staring at you anymore.

You paused for a moment when you arrived at the solid steel door ahead of you. It didn't look like it had a knob or latch, or any way of opening it from this side. You tried to give it a knock, but only managed to make a soft "thunk" when your hand made contact. You waited for a second, but it was clear that it didn't really manage to make a sound. You grunt before trying to give it a firm kick, the sound ringing out a bit more this time. You swallow as you wait there for a second, before you see the door open a crack.

"Surprised you're still in one piece." You hear an unfamiliar voice from beyond the door, and spot an eye peeking through the crack. "There was a pot going around the place, and some had put money down for the ferret swallowing you before the hour's up."

"W-wha... You're all..." You clench your first a bit, but shake your head and give a small grunt as you try to keep your mind clear. You try to keep calm, trying to figure out exactly what you should say. They certainly weren't listening to what you wanted, but they at least seemed to want to keep Pyrrhus in passable condition for the moment. "Whatever... Look. I... I think that I'm going to be... That he wants me to stay with him."

"Thanks for the warning, but we already knew that. I'm not going to be the one to argue with him, and the lieutenant says to let him do whatever as long as he stays put in his room."

"I'm not asking for a rescue or anything right now." You see the main raise an eyebrow, but give your head a quick shake. "Look. Can I just... You know. Get a few sheets or something for when I sleep? We have some laying around in the place, right? I think that we should have some in storage, at least..."

"You're gonna sleep with that thing watching? Your call, I suppose.” The man shook his head quietly, rolling his eyes a bit. “Hang on a second..." You hear a momentary bit of static, and notice the man pulling back and raise his arm up. You hear him speaking into what you assume is a radio, and hear a muffled response. "Someone will bring it over later."

"O-okay... Thanks... Hope that they get here sometime today..." You try to look around, the lighting in the labs making it difficult for you to figure out what the time Is. As you do, you hear a laugh from beyond the door."

"I wouldn't count on it. Most of us are busy enough preparing for our big guest, here. " The man seemed to pause, shaking his head a bit. "And that's not counting the number of people they're using as guards. You should just be glad that you're still in one piece."

You open your mouth to speak, but close it before you say a word. You certainly didn't feel like Pyrrhus would be a danger to you, but you weren't in a place to speak. He had just admitted to a rather massive bit of destruction, and though he seemed calm now, you weren't quite sure exactly how he might react. "Fine... I'd just... appreciate it if I could get it before night or something." You start to turn away, but stop as something registers in your mind. "Wait a minute... What do you mean, 'Preparing for him?' " You couldn't help getting an ominous feeling at those words, but the man laughed again before speaking.

"Oh, don't worry. We were given orders to keep him alive. If the higher-ups wanted him dead, you'd know. We're quite ready to put him down if he acts out too much, but we brought him here alive for a reason. We're not going to be put his life in danger. Not unless we have a good reason to..."

You swallow a bit, but manage to speak out softly. "W-well, then... What do you need to prepare for?"

"Are you crazy? You think it's even possible to suddenly drag a hundred-foot beast in without some preparation? The lab might be set up for someone like him to suddenly drop in, but nobody really keeps everything ready for a giant to drop in at any moment. There are still some other things that need to get done. And right now," He quietly stated, his eyes turned from the door and his back facing you as he spoke, "we need to get a few more things done quickly. After all..."

142121111121.content:
"…Well," Pyrrhus begins, "you might as well hear my side of things. Who knows what shit they'll end up telling you," he says, gesturing towards the entrance of the room. "Better make yourself comfy."

He opens his palm and lets you move down onto the bed itself. Sitting down on the cold sheets, you lean back against his thigh, which is significantly warmer in comparison. "Okay, I think I'm as comfy as I'm gonna get."

"Fine. Here goes nothing." He closes his eyes and takes a deep breath, then begins. "So about a month or so ago, I was more or less like you, probably. I mean, I still had my ferrety good looks and all, and I didn't intern at a crazy research lab or anything, but in other respects, I was a typical teenage fur. I wasn't super popular or anything, but I had friends, I had a normal life."

You nod, trying to picture Pyrrhus as anything but the one-hundred foot tall giant that he is now. The more you considered it, though, the more you felt that he might have fit in with you and your circle of friends.

He continues, "That all came to a crashing halt, though, the day of the accident."

Your eyes widen a little. "Accident? What kind of accident?"

He looks at you with a slight sense of sadness in his eyes. "The kind that explodes in your face and causes you to be doused head to toe in radioactive beams during a field trip to a local nuclear plant."

"That's-- that's horrible!"

"Yeah, it was," Pyrrhus nods. "Half the class and nearly all the plant workers who were in the room where the explosion happened died within a few hours of the accident from massive radiation poisoning, if they didn't die immediately at the scene from the blast. But a few of us escaped with seemingly no injuries."

You tilt your head to the side in puzzlement. "How is that possible?"

The ferret shrugs, scoffing as he does so. "Beats me. When the doctors examined us, they found no trace of radiation in our bodies at all, even though the room was (and still is) flooded with it."

"Hmm," you think for a few moments, "it's almost as if the radiation just bounced off of your body."

"Maybe. Hell if I know." Pyrrhus rolls on his side towards the wall, causing the bed to shift for a moment and knocking you over. You jump to your feet and move a bit closer to the edge of the bed, afraid of what would happen if he suddenly rolls the other way. “But anyways, the doctors kept a close eye on me after the accident, taking blood samples and measurements and stuff twice a day. Nothing seemed to change until about a week after the accident, when I suddenly grew about six inches overnight. The next day, I woke up about ten feet tall, and the day after that I was about the size I am now.”

“Wow, it happened that quickly?” Something about the idea of Pyrrhus growing big so fast seems... Well, you're not sure exactly how you feel about it, but it certainly is interesting.

“Yeah, well,” Pyrrhus turns his head back towards you. “You can probably figure out the rest on your own. The police, then the military started coming after me, I... responded, and...” He makes a circular motion with his hands. “Yada yada yada, I'm imprisoned here in a cell like a lab rat, and I have a tiny mop jockey for a roommate. Any questions?”

You can tell that Pyrrhus seems to be a little perturbed or upset at having to recount the story, but there’s still a lot of holes you want filled in. “Well,” you say hesitatingly, “you said that there were a few others who were there at the accident but who didn't die. Does that mean -- did they, uh... grow too?"

Pyrrhus seems to take a moment longer to respond than normal, before finally answering...

"Okay," Pyrrhus mutters, "but you better not ask me to turn my head and cough or bend over or anything like that. I'm already exposed enough as it is."

“Relax,” the fox says. “The entire procedure is done with advanced equipment, mostly using lasers. You’ll never even feel a thing. Just sit down by the table and take a few deep breaths.”

Sighing, Pyrrhus follows the instructions, sitting down on a makeshift chair which you soon realize is made of several large metal crates stacked together. At first, Pyrrhus holds you on his lap, but after a few moments the fox clears his throat. “Um, I'm sorry, but in order for us to get the correct measurements, you can’t be... carrying... someone, like that,” he says, motioning in your direction. “Can you please set him down on the table?”

Pyrrhus rolls his eyes but complies, and the fox quietly leaves the room. As you are freed from the giant ferret’s fingers, you gasp, taking in as much fresh air as you can. You don’t mind being around the big ferret and keeping him company, but the sudden movement of being lifted up and down fifty or seventy-five feet in the air at a time is beginning to make you queasy.

After a few moments, you become aware of a gradual humming building from the equipment that’s sitting on the table. There are several large machines, looking a little something like what you imagine old military supercomputers should look like, with lots of blinking lights and whirring dials that start coming to life. “Didn’t they say this was ’advanced’ equipment?” you say to Pyrrhus as a wry smile begins to creep across your face. “It looks like something that belongs in the fifties!”

Pyrrhus chuckles, shaking his head. “Hey, your taxpayer dollars at work, right?”

A few minutes later, the room grows silent once again. “Is that it?” you ask aloud, assuming the fox (or whoever is running the tests) can hear through embedded microphones or something. “Are we done?”

Indeed, the fox’s voice responds through a loudspeaker attached to the wall. “Yes, we’re done for tonight. The two of you may return to your room. A doctor will stop in tomorrow morning to ask some follow-up questions.”

“Finally,” Pyrrhus says as he sighs in relief, standing up and scooping you back into his paw.

As you head back through the halls to the room, Pyrrhus brings you up closer to his face, and you can tell he's uncomfortable about something. “Hey Ridge?” he asks, his voice much lower than before.

“Yes?”

“...Thanks.” He looks down away, running his other paw through his hair.

“For what?”

Her bulk still filled most of the door frame, but the weasel was able to squirm his way in regardless. He did so, doing his best to ignore the way she wrinkled her nose at his passing. He was nervous. His musk was always strong when he was nervous.

Still, it didn't hurt to be as cordial as possible. "Thank you so much Mrs. Grimes. It's truly a pleasure to be in your wonderful home."

Mrs. Grimes snorted as she shut the door. "Not so much at the moment. Please excuse the mess. Ever since we found out Victor's diagnosis, things have been a little hectic." She shuffled forward past him, nearly pushing him against the wall. She looked tired, but she was doing her best not to show it.

"There's no need to apologize, Mrs. Grimes. I get the feeling that your home on a bad day is still so much cleaner than my apartment on its best." He looked at the living room before following her towards the back of the house. It was a cluttered place, a room that had obviously been lived in for quite some time, but it had been kept painstakingly clean. It smelled strongly of industrial cleaner, though Will could catch a whiff of the family that lived her underneath all that. He chuckled to himself. She had taken great care to tidy up before he arrived, despite what she said.

The big bear chuckled and looked down at him over her shoulder. "You're too kind," she purred. She lead him to the kitchen, which she filled almost entirely by herself. Will couldn't imagine what it must have been like for the whole family here. Though she was the smallest, she still towered over him at seven feet. Her son and husband were much bigger, bulkier. It must have been all they could do not to trip over each other all the time. "Please, call me Barbara."

She stuck out her hand and he took it. He didn't have to bend to kiss it, but he bowed after he did anyway. She chuckled and put her free hand to her muzzle, doing her best to look demure. Will smiled broadly. It was nice to know he still had it. "All right, Barbara," he said. "I don't want to take up much more of your time. I figured I'd just get to meet Victor for right now, talk for maybe fifteen minutes before heading home. We'll set up our interview schedule so it's not too much a strain on any of you, but I have to insist on at least three times a week."

Barbara nodded, then looked out the back door behind her. Will could just make out movement over her shoulder. "Oh, of course," she said, then smoothed her immense hands on her apron. "I don't think Victor's going to go back to college this semester until we can figure all of this out, so he'll have plenty of time."

Will smiled, rows of small sharp teeth suddenly visible. "You mean he's not going to get a job this summer?"

Barbara chuckled, but her face fell slightly. "I don't think there's a place that'll take him now."

Will winced inwardly. "You'd be surprised. Most guys are a shoe-in for construction work once they're diagnosed. Plenty of 'em are leading quite productive lives now that...well, now that we know this isn't going away. We're doing our best to make sure those first few instances don't set the reputation for everyone with the disease."

Barbara's smile returned, though it wasn't as bright as it was before. "I know, Mr. Bauer. I can't thank you enough for the work you're doing here. It means the world to me and Mikhail."

He smiled and nodded, setting down his briefcase and plucking out a notepad. "It's my job, ma'am. I'd hate to think that we'd shun certain people just when they needed us the most to make sense of what was happening to them. By the way, call me William."

The weasel walked out of the kitchen door to the Grimes' expansive back yard. Barbara had done quite a bit of work on it -- a line of fruit trees dominated the back fence, and there were small islands of herbs, rosebushes, grapevines and other flowers laid about, like mines of color and fragrance. Of course, that only caught the eye for a moment. What really grabbed your attention was the reason that Will was here in the first place -- the giant bear sitting against the big apple tree at the edge of the yard.

Victor had been diagnosed with chronic hyper-gigantia two weeks ago, and in that span of time he had doubled in size from eight feet (just under the tallest bear ever recorded) to nearly sixteen feet. He hadn't finished growing yet, of course, and the latest reports seemed to indicate that he would start growing in random, but potent spurts. No one knew just how tall he was going to get. Of the couple thousand hyper-gigantic cases that had sprung up in the past year, not one of them ever seemed to truly finish growing. Fenn Richards, the wolf who was the first recorded case, was nearing 600 feet tall at last report. According to the authorities up in Massachusetts, detaining him was getting to be impossible.

The bear in the backyard had nothing to do with that, of course, except for sharing the same condition. But Fenn's actions had put the fear of these "macros" -- that's what the media called them -- quite clearly in the public's mind. And once that first impression had set, it would be awfully hard to shake. That's why William's work was so important. He had to prove, scientifically and beyond the shadow of a doubt, that hyper-gigantia didn't cause dementia, aggression or any of the other mental traumas it had come to be associated with. While growing to the size of a skyscraper had to do crazy things to your psychology, it didn't necessarily make you a bloodthirsty monster. Or so he hoped.

William smiled as he approached the bear. Victor smiled back, and didn't bother getting up. Even sitting the young bear towered over the weasel, and standing would only make the size difference that much more pronounced.

"Good evening, Victor. I'm Dr. William Bauer." He smiled and offered his paw. "I'm here to ask you a few questions..."

1431.content:
At 21 years old, Victor was more or less an adult bear, which in normal circumstances would make him over eight feet tall and an imposing sight to anyone. His body was thick with musculature, although there was that ever present bear fat that just made them all the bulkier. His fur was thick as well; in fact, everything about bears seemed to be designed to make them seem as big as possible.

The hyper-gigantia had only helped in that department. At sixteen feet, he was now twice the average adult bear height, and now bigger than any recorded bear before the outbreak of this... disease? Mutation? Evolution? Each word held a connotation that someone would disagree with, and none quite fit whatever was going on. It wasn't a disease, as there was no truly negative impact on the body. It wasn't a mutation, since most of the cases had never been in the same place before, and no radiation beyond normal levels were present in any of the macros. It wasn't evolution, at least as far as he could tell, because he'd never heard of a species suddenly growing to a hundred times their previous height before. Whatever the proper term might be, that kind of speculation would wait for later. After all, this was his first time actually meeting someone with the... condition. Yes, that would be an acceptable word for now, the weasel thought to himself.

He had studied cases like these for months, learning all that was known about hyper-gigantia. He knew the average growth rate for various progressions of the condition, he knew the more famous cases, he knew that there was no difference in the way males and females were affected, though males seemed to be more likely to become macros, at a rate of nearly four boys to one girl. His mathematical proficiency came in great handy, calculating size differences, heights, weights, and comparisons to objects in real life in order to accurately assess needs and statistics of macros. He'd been a valuable resource for those working in the field, and now he was finally getting his own turn. The news had come in just a couple days ago, and he had fervently studied: copying all his research notes and studies to flash drives to bring with him, printing off charts of how Victor's growth would likely develop, making arrangements with food suppliers in the area, and even bringing along a program he'd designed that rendered two 3-D models of different heights, so he could make visual comparisons without needing to be in person. And yet, despite all that preparation, nothing prepared him for the enormous bear shaking his hand.

At two and a half times his size, Victor's hand engulfed his, swallowing it in a mass of soft yet leathery pads and coarse yet smooth and comfortable dark brown fur. William looked down and saw only Victor's hand in a ball, his own hand vanished from sight within the macro's grip. He could almost feel the delicacy of the grip that he was applying, so incredibly powerful and yet being gentle enough to just hold the weasel's hand. And yet, in that instant, William could sense the strength that this macro held, at only twice his original height. He shivered slightly, a little more nervous than before.

"It's nice to meet you, Dr. Bauer, sir. I'll do my best to answer your questions," the giant said, nodding his head as he spoke. His voice, like the rest of him, was in the final stages of growing up but still amplified. It was deep, loud, and definitively masculine. His eyes, crystalline and green, held sadness with a trace of fear, as expected from someone who wakes up to find themselves turning into a giant. His titanic body was bare except for a modestly placed blanket across his lap; the custom designed clothes would arrive in a day, and in the meanwhile Victor would have to make do with makeshift loincloths. William took the moment to look him over, noting the impressive musculature and thick fur all over the grizzly body. Even if he wasn't a giant, the 21-year-old would have still been built like a tank and an incredible sight to see.

The weasel tried not to think about how unbelievably attractive Victor was and turned to his pad, his nervous musk thick in the air as he cleared his throat and started asking the basic questions. Did you eat anything odd? Do you feel sick or anything during the growth spurts? How many growth spurts have you experienced so far? Did you ever have contact with this man, Fenn Richards? They all seemed silly questions, little more than far reaches that had been used for the first hundred cases or so and now were basically meaningless. Still, protocol was protocol.

Victor seemed like a nice guy. He spoke politely, never interrupted, always answered directly and explained when necessary. There was a distinctly sad tone to his voice; a few friends had decided to leave him alone, and he was isolated from a lot of people because of his condition. It was clear that he considered himself a freak and just wanted to get back to normal again. A common opinion, but William hoped he'd be able to change the bear's mind eventually.

Soon, William folded his pad and clicked his pen shut, nodding thoughtfully as he tapped the paper. "Alright, well, I don't want to keep you too long for these first couple of sessions. We'll ease into longer and longer sessions together as your hyper-gigantia develops. Now, I want you to know that although I am here to observe and assist, you should consider me more as a friend than a caretaker. I have to go for now, but I suggest looking for work at a construction or demolition company. People with your condition are highly valued, and you're the only case for a few hundred miles in any direction, so you'll be considered very important by them."

The mother returned and the three of them spoke for a while, eventually settling on having William come back in a couple of days to have another session with Victor. "You have a nice day, ma'am," he said, kissing her hand again and bowing. Then he turned back to the giant and smiled. His lips parted to speak, and then he noticed for the first time a growing musk in the air besides his own. He looked ever so slightly down and saw the large bulge in the blanket on the bear's lap; his cheeks flustered and he hesitated for a moment before speaking. "Victor, I know it may seem bad right now, but your condition is what you make it to be. I'll see you in a couple of days."

The bear nodded, the slightest hint of a blush on his cheeks as he shifted his legs a little. "See you later, Dr. Bauer, sir."

"Please, call me William."

As you get the coffee machine going and start some toast, you spot Molly sitting at the table with a book in her slender (for her size) hand. "So...that's what you've been doing with my books, dragging them to your bed and such." you say coolly.

"Sorry about that...I've long been trying to read. I know you've seen me a few times -" Molly starts, but you say, "What? How did you...?"

"My nose is like a million times better than yours, good sir, I could smell you there. Your toast's burning, by the way."

You rush over to the toaster just in time to see your toast become unsalvageable. Blasted machine either barely warmed the bread or burnt it to a blackened crisp. It's due for the scrap heap. You consider offering the charred toast to Molly, but she shakes her head. "Uh-uh. Burnt toast tastes worse than book covers, and those are terrible." shrugging, you toss it into the garbage.

"Guess I'll just have coffee this time." you mutter, and then ask, "Same deal with staring into my laptop screen?"

Molly answers, nodding, "Yep. I admit, while most dogs don't care about what their human masters do when it doesn't involve them, but I've always wanted to be able to emulate that. Do what they can do. Eheh...I guess now I got what I've wanted, didn't I?"
15321.title: One weird day.

choices: "I guess it can wait a bit."
153212.content:
While you try to enjoy your coffee, Molly's ears perk up. Yet she remains quiet, possibly really into the book she's reading. Usually when her ears do that a bark or two isn't far away. Then the doorbell rings. Shrugging, you go to the door to see who it is. No sooner do you unlock the door does it nearly slam into your face with the person on the other side opening it so quickly. "Hey, buddy! Thought I'd drop in! ...You okay?"

Kris. It had to be Kris. She's just a few inches shorter than you at 5'10", and almost constantly full of energy. She's really quite pretty. "I'm...fine, Kris. Er, how many times have I asked you to wait for me to open the door instead of flinging it open yourself?" you say.

"Whoops. Sorry. I'll try to remember for next time." Kris replies sheepishly, then asks, "Say...don't you have a dog here? Molly, wasn't it? Where is she? Doesn't she like greeting people? ...You didn't..."

"I haven't sold Molly, and I haven't put her down. I'm guessing you want to see her?" you answer, slightly worriedly.

"Well...yeah. Why wouldn't I? She's such a nice dog, and sooo soft and fluffy!" Kris replies excitedly at the thought. Sometimes you wonder if her brain was still that of a 10 year old rather than the 24 year old she is...

You were afraid of this. You have no idea how Molly became...how she is, much less explain it to someone else. Kris is sensible...most of the time, and you've never kept a secret from her, so why start now? "Alright, fine. Give me a sec." you tell her, then go back into the kitchen.

Kris crouches down in anticipation of Molly running into her open arms to greet her...but gets a surprise when she sees a pair of dog paws that make a great dane's look like a chihuahua's. Heck, they're bigger than anyone's feet she's ever met. Kris' mouth opens agape as she looks up...and up...and up. "Hiya, Kris! Er, you don't need to be crouching down like that..."

"M-Molly?! You...you can talk?! What happened to you, girl?" Kris stammers in disbelief, further compounded by the fact Molly still towers way over her even after standing up again. As everything sinks in, Kris begins to take in Molly's other features. She herself has a modest C cup and an hourglass figure she's proud to show off when she can, but Molly makes her seem utterly flat as a board.

"It's a question I'd like to know myself." you admit from behind Molly. "I go to bed last night with her as a perfectly normal dog, and I wake up to...well, this."

"Eheh...guess that makes three of us..." Molly answers sheepishly with a hand behind her head. "I don't know what happened to me last night, only that I woke up like this. But I like it! It's like a dream come true!"

"She's always wanted to be capable of doing the things humans can do, apparently." you explain before Kris asks, and then offer, "Um, how about some coffee? It might be a tad cold now, but there's still some left in the pot."

Kris quickly nods in agreement and follows you to the kitchen. Molly closes the door and then returns to her book, tail wagging behind her. You pour a cup of coffee for your friend as pitch black as her hair and give it to her. You then get a glass and fill it with water for Molly to sip on, trusting her not to spill it all over the book. It still feels very weird to be doing this for what's been your pet for the past few years, but it's something you're just going to have to get used to.

Speaking of which...can Molly even be considered your pet anymore? She easily seems as sentient...sapient...whatever as you, Kris, and any other human around. And your love for her hasn't changed, thus you want what's best for her... Finally, you settle on friend. It seems to fit nicely. ...You start realizing a lot of your decisions come down to 'seeming to fit nicely'.

Meanwhile, Kris sips at her coffee, looking at Molly with a mix of jealousy over having a superior figure than her and admiration. You know the kind of weird stuff your friend is into, including women of far greater than normal size. You don't question it, and occasionally enjoy a picture or story that she shares via email. In fact, it was one of those emails that Molly had been staring at on your laptop that time. "...Um, what is that smell? Did something burn?" she asks, sniffing.

"His toast burnt in the toaster. Any longer and I swear it would've tripped the smoke alarm." Molly answers.

"Dude, are you still using that hunk of crap?! It belongs in a museum it's so old!" Kris says.

"I've been meaning to replace it..." you respond weakly.

Kris' response:
153212.title: A friend of yours drops by!

choices: You confront the man outside the store.
Turns out Molly isn't the only one of her kind...
1532121.content:
"Well let's go do that!" and with that Kris begins to quickly drag you by the arm towards the door excitedly. This isn't new to you, she's been doing this since kindergarten. And not just to her childhood friend, either. (you never did subscribe to the idea that girls had 'cooties') She may not appear muscular, but she's stronger than one might think, especially when she has momentum on her side.

You and her come to a screeching halt, however, once Molly grabs Kris by the arm. Most others that have tried only end up going along for the ride, barely slowing her down, but the 8'6" Molly has far more mass both overall and in her muscles to completely break Kris' forward momentum without so much as budging. Note to self: don't make Molly angry. "Hold up! We can go once he finishes his coffee. And you don't need to drag him!" she says with slight worry.

Kris is rather surprised at this, but concedes and lets you go before Molly does the same to her. You finish your coffee while Kris finishes hers, meanwhile wondering just how the hell Molly is even going to fit in your car. You're 6 feet tall, and your head cuts it pretty close with the roof. Molly's head is going to be mashed up into it, and her long legs are certain to not have enough room.

Soon enough, the three of you are out the door. Naturally, Molly has to duck to get through the door frame. Kris takes her car while you and Molly take yours. She seems very uncomfortably cramped in the passenger seat, but at the same time she seems...happy. "Don't stick your head out the window. I didn't allow it when you were still just a dog, I'm not allowing it now." you remark offhandedly as you start the car.

"Don't worry... I might snap my neck if I tried to do that now. Kind of squished in here..." Molly answers back as the car starts to move.

"Well humans don't exactly build these things for someone of your stature in mind. You could probably stare the tallest person in history in the face without having to look up." you say, and you're on your way to town. You don't mention it, but you suspect that Molly's weight may play havoc with your car's fuel economy. You learned in high school that mentioning a girl's weight to her is generally a very bad idea, getting you dumped and a high chance of things being thrown at your head.

Still, you make it in town just fine, and Kris' car isn't far behind. You're slightly concerned about people's opinions towards Molly, but now is as good a time as any. You turn off your car and get out, then head over to the passenger side to help Molly out. As you approach the entrance, she stops cold. "No pets allowed..." she reads.

"Yeah, they don't want dogs or cats in the store making a mess." you explain and then add, "I don't think you count as much of a pet anymore do you?"

Molly smiles and shakes her head, then heads inside with you and Kris. Inside, she's easily distracted by nearly everything around, having never been inside any store other than that pet store you got her from a few years ago, and even then she hadn't been in there long. The other people in the store just stare, mostly in shock. Some women mutter envy at her figure. Some men try to steal glances at her before their wives notice. Others ponder just what the heck this feminine fur covered giant is. You suspect many of the people attracted to females here may be fighting the urge to try and make passionate love with her.

Eventually, Kris comes running back to you with a toaster...one that has way more features than you'd ever care to use. "How about this one? This one's cool!" she exclaims excitedly.

"You want it you can buy it, but when am I going to need a toaster that has a built in TV and tells me the weather forecast for the next week when all I really want it to do is toast stuff without burning it to a crisp?" you reply.

"Spoil sport." Kris says and proceeds to take it back.

With a slight nudge, you remind Molly of your reason for being here. "We can come back another time. Let's get what we came here for an be on our way." you tell her, to which she nods and puts the multipurpose flashlight down gently. You and her follow Kris' trail and soon catch up with your friend.

On the way to the checkout, Molly accidentally bumps into a middle aged man, causing him to fall to the floor and his basket of stuff to go in various directions. " Oh! I'm so sorry! Let me help you pick up your stuff..." she apologizes as she bends down to begin helping.

"Ah! A f-f-furry! Don't hurt me! I've got a family to go home to!" the man yelps in fear, causing Molly to tilt her head in confusion. Admittedly, she rather likes the term, but the fearful reaction confuses her. Still, she picks up all the spilled items and places them back in the basket, then firmly grabs the man and gently helps him back to his feet before returning the basket to him. Rather than thank her, he bolts off as though Death itself was after him.

"What was his problem..." Molly mutters, still partly confused and saddened by the reaction, as shown by her drooped ears and tail.
1532121.title: Toaster shopping with Kris and Molly!

15321212.content:
"So this man bumps into you by accident, you try to help him, and he...acts like you intend to rip him limb from limb? Am I getting this right?" you ask Molly as you, her, and Kris exit the store. You had seen what had happened, you're just trying to recollect it all in the hopes of making sense of it.

"I guess? I don't know what he thought I was going to do to him... Though I kind of like the sound of the term furry." Molly replies.

"Cuckoo..." Kris adds, circling her finger around her ear as the universal sign of crazy.

You however are not so sure the man is crazy. You were basically right there when it happened, and the guy seemed perfectly sane up until that point. There has to be some rational explanation for such behavior. However, your thoughts are interrupted by an angry growl as your stomach reminds you it's unhappy about this morning. "Heh. Sounds like it's food time and someone's stomach isn't taking no for an answer." Molly giggles slightly.

"Crap. Kind of forgot I've been running on empty. Well, I'm supposed to meet Ryan for lunch a little ways from here...I don't think he'll mind a couple others joining." you mention, figuring a meal may help with the mystery. It's not worth driving there, so you walk to the meeting place with them. Molly does her best to keep your relatively slower pace thanks to her longer stride.

As it turns out, the place is a pizzeria. You find out when you arrive that Ryan has reserved a table outside, and are led to it. Again, there's some stares in Molly's direction, but many are busy with their meals at the moment. The three of you take your seats and order drinks while you wait for him to show up.

It's not long before Ryan shows up and greets you with, "Hi, bud! Glad you could make it!" he then turns his attention to Kris, "And Kris! Haven't seen you in months! And..." finally he notices Molly, and his reaction is completely unexpected, being that of obvious fear. "O-oh...um...h-hi Ms. furry..."

"Okay, what is going on here?" Kris asks bluntly, "That guy at the store was one thing, but you too? What's so scary here?!"

Molly has no idea why she's scared Ryan, but it's starting to irk her. Just as the wind shifts, she catches the scents of many of the customers. Some wearing perfume, others not. One scent though gets her attention: someone wearing a simple robe with the hood over their head. This one is different from the rest...

"What's so scary? These furries have been causing nothing but destruction everywhere they go, casually hurting innocent people they come across. Your 'friend' here will tear your heads from your bodies the moment she gets bored!" Ryan accuses.

"I've done nothing but try to be nice and helpful all day. I'd never even think about harming so much as a hair on the man who's given me a loving home for over three years now or Kris! Or anyone for that matter!" Molly angrily barks at Ryan in retaliation. Seems to you that the very thought of being accused as a monster disgusts her greatly.

"Wait...you...you're Molly..." Ryan realizes from the three years comment. He's met her as a dog several times, enjoying getting to play ball with her. Finally he sits down and stops making a scene.

"Yep, that's me, Ryan." Molly responds happily, though internally she's curious. Who or what are these other furries, and why do they seek to cause such misery? These thoughts are put to the side as the pizza is brought to the table in all its cheesy, topping loaded glory.

Ryan usually ordered an extra large pizza when he came here, foolishly thinking he'd eat the rest the next day or so only to toss it when it was too moldy to possibly consider edible a month or so later. You've a very distinct feeling that there isn't going to be anything leftover today.

Molly would have loved to just dive right in...but she restrains herself and watches how you, Kris, and Ryan handle the pizza so she can do that herself. In the end, she winds up eating nearly half of the pizza herself after everyone else has taken all they want. Finally, the bill comes and everyone at the table helps to pay it except for Molly due to not having any means to do so. The four of you stand, and Ryan gets his first glimpse at just how big Molly really is. He's slightly taller and more muscular than you, but pales in comparison to her 8'6" frame. You're certain that either her sheer size has caused him to pee his pants a little, or her amazing figure has caused him to cum in there. You don't want to know which.

Molly notices the odd robed figure rise from his seat and approach. "A furry out in the open with humans no less..." he speaks lowly, surprising her with how neutrally he said the term. "Follow me if you wish to know more. The choice is yours, but your friends are welcome to join if they want..." he continues and then quietly takes his leave.

You swear for just a second that you see something move behind him beneath his robe, but he's gone before you can take another glance. "If we're going to follow that guy, we should, y'know, get a move on and do it before he vanishes like a freaking ninja?" Kris suggests somewhat helpfully.
15321212.title: Not the only one.

choices: A violent furry attacks in town!
153212121.content:
"And what if it's a trap? We could be walking right into it." Ryan counters, "I'm just saying maybe we shouldn't be trusting guys who don't reveal their faces."

Molly shakes her head and replies, "He's not interested in you, he's interested in me. And if he wanted to trap me for some reason, why would he invite you guys too and make the job harder? I wouldn't worry about losing him, I've still got his scent."

"She's got a point there, Ryan. Besides, no one's forcing you to come." you say.

Eventually, you all agree to follow the mysterious robed figure. You can't see him anywhere, but Molly leads the way and you trust her. The path leads to a more run-down part of town, and less people are around. When Molly slows and stops, you're right in front of a surprisingly well maintained yet seemingly abandoned building. If you hadn't been led here, you would have passed it by without a second thought.

"Ooh, so this is like a secret hideout isn't it?" Kris asks with interest.

"What makes you so sure it is?" Ryan questions.

"Actually, the lady here is close to the truth." A voice says quietly, causing everyone to turn around and see the robed figure from earlier. "Please, come inside. I must apologize, Molly, but this facility is ill prepared for the comfort of one of your stature."

"I'm getting used to being kind of tall for places." Molly says.

Finally, you enter the building with Molly ducking through the doorway, and the robed figure closes the door behind you. Inside is surprisingly well lit and the walls seem like a lot of care has been done to restore them, albeit patchy in spots. You can see some eyes in the shadows, as though unsure about the presence of strangers. Then with a sigh, the robed figure reaches up and lowers his hood, revealing his face for the first time.

"Holy...you're a furry, too!" Ryan states the obvious. The robed furry continues to remove the robe and gloves, fully revealing himself as a white tiger furry. His limbs appear to ripple with fluid power not unlike a non-humanoid tiger would. Surprisingly, he's almost fully clothed aside from his feet, though they're ripped and torn in places.

"Indeed I am. As is everyone else in this facility aside from yourselves. My name is Tiberius, and this is a sanctuary for my kind." Tiberius acknowledges and then announces, "It's alright, everyone, these humans are with the dog furry named Molly."

The watchful furries come into view. A female bat waves friendlily and says, "Hi! Wow, you're huge! Cool!" She's maybe 5'7" and kind of cute, even wearing a smiley face t-shirt and a short skirt. A bull gives a respectful nod. There are others, but the one that catches your attention is a very tall and busty white mare with eyes as blue as the ocean who says to Molly, "Hello! My name's Breeze. It's a pleasure to meet you, and if I may add, a slight relief to know I'm not the tallest one around here that's still friendly. I'm sure my master would love to meet you!"

Breeze is...magnificent, though about a foot shorter than Molly. Maybe a bit bustier, but Kris would likely kill you if you tried to confirm that. "As you can see, we're not all what you think of us. You, Ryan, believe us all destructive monsters." Tiberius begins, only for the bat to shout, "That's not true! Humans are cool! Even like this I don't know how any of us could make these buildings and stuff!"

Tiberius growls slightly at her and she sheepishly quiets down. "Mizuru can be quite vocal when it comes to certain subjects, though I fear this trait may get her killed if she isn't careful. The truth is, many of us wish only to coexist with humans peacefully and not harm them unless forced to defend ourselves."

"So if you're all supposed to be so friendly, how do you explain that guy who got impaled with a horn while being pulverized into the foundation of a building recently?" Ryan says with some confusion.

The bull replies, "I knew him. Carl was a good man, said he'd introduce me to his little girl. Ol' Alex would've given her the most epic ride in her five year old life...though I'm sure Breeze could beat the pants off me for rides. You look at her and tell me she's anything less than purebred. But that rhino didn't care at all... There's some like him that force us to hide because of the mistrust they cause."

"So why haven't you guys tried to clear your names? Why not confront the ones that do this and tell them to stop?" Molly asks.

"Unfortunately, humans aren't easily trusting of any perceived threat. I believe your friend here has demonstrated this quite clearly." Tiberius responds looking in Ryan's direction, who blushes heavily with embarrassment. You figure it to be because of Breeze and Mizuru.

Breeze adds, "As for why we don't tell them to cease, these furries are incredibly violent even to their own kind. If there is an intelligence behind their barbarism, it's buried well and is uninterested in listening to reason."

"Lovely..." you mutter sarcastically.
153212121.title: Meeting Tiberius.

choices: Continue heading for home, it's been a long day.
1532121211.content:
"So my kind is either incredibly violent, or incredibly cowardly?" Molly asks incredulously.

Immediately, you notice the others backing away from Alex with quiet mutters. Tiberius brings a hand up to gently pinch the bridge of his muzzle in front of his eyes muttering, "Oh no..."

"Cowardly? You think us cowardly?!" Alex yells, standing up to Molly. "Well?! Do you?!"

His towering 6'5" size and horns would be enough to make near anyone mess themselves in terror in this circumstance, but he still doesn't come up to the base of Molly's neck. So his display doesn't appear to phase her in the least as she answers with her hands on her hips, "I've yet to see or hear of anything to suggest otherwise, so why don't you disprove it?"

"My human friends would call me many things. Cowardly isn't one of them. Those violent guys don't listen to reason, and when faced with one that's like at least 15 or 20 feet tall when they get going, all we can do is try to get people and ourselves out of their way before anyone gets hurt." Mizuru explains, "Alex wasn't able to get Carl to safety in time. He tried to buy as much time for him as he could, but that rhino just tossed him aside like a toy."

"Despite our efforts, however, people rarely remember us trying to help them, only the ones that attacked." Tiberius adds.

"Er, maybe we should head home before anyone does something they'll regret, if they haven't already..." you suggest.

"Y-yes, that sounds like a wonderful idea. Though maybe someone should go with you to ensure you reach your destinations safely?" Breeze says, hoping the situation defuses.

"Very well. Mizuru and I shall escort you." Tiberius says, and then you head outside.

Once out, Kris leads the way back into the main part of town with everyone else following. If you had known just how far away from your car you were going to end up, you'd have moved it closer. "Is anyone else getting a bad feeling about this?" Ryan asks nervously.

"What, walking around town with an anthro? Didn't you learn anything at the sanctuary?" Mizuru teases slightly.

"No, more like we shouldn't be out here..." he replies.

You're about to tell him he's making a fuss over nothing when a massive humanoid rhino smashes his way into view. "Don't tell me...not a friendly."

"Eep!" Kris yelps, barely avoiding the rhinos' huge fist trying to flatten her. Everyone in the area is soon either transfixed on the 20 foot behemoth or panicking as he indiscriminately attacks anything around him.

"Get out of here, NOW!" Tiberius yells desperately to the bystanders as he tries to halt the rhino, but fails to even slow him down. Mizuru joins in pulling at the beast's bulky leg, but only makes the slightest difference. You, Ryan, and Kris try to get everyone away from there.

"If this keeps up...someone's bound to get killed. I've gotta try something..." Molly mutters to herself and then calls to the rhino, "Hey! UGLY! Over here!" he turns his attention towards her...but only for a moment before returning to his path of destruction.

"Okay...guess I don't have a choice." she says and then begins concentrating. As she does, her perspective shifts upward as she grows larger and larger.

You turn and watch in amazement as Molly reaches 20 feet herself and then surpasses it without slowing down. "Holy crap..." is all you can manage to say. The others too see her expanding frame until she stops at around 35 feet tall.

Molly walks up to the rhino and taps him on the shoulder. "Hey. Your destructive antics aren't sitting well with me or my friends. Beat it now, and I won't kick your sorry butt into next year!" she tells him threateningly, grinding a fist into her other hand.

This time she successfully has the rhino's full attention. However, he swings a huge fist straight into Molly's gut. She winces, then grabs his arm and uses it to throw him to the ground with some effort. "Seems your violence wasn't overblown... And would you look at what you made me do? You've made me have to break the road a bit!" she says angrily, adrenaline pumping.

The rhino gets up without care and lowers his head to charge. Thinking quickly, Molly sidesteps him then leaps and slams him in the back with a kick, sending him sprawling to the ground. As he attempts to get up again, she steps on his back and shoves him back down. "Uh-uh. Stay down. Now, let's talk. Why the HELL are you attacking people and their homes? Ruining the anthros NOT AT ALL like you's chances of getting along with humans peacefully? What have ANY of them done to you?" she yells with rather painful volume at the beast.

Then the rhino begins to shrink and...seemingly vanishes, and Molly's foot stomps down into the ground from the sudden lack of support beneath it. "What the...where did he go?" she asks aloud much more quietly. She then quickly looks around, taking extra care directly beneath her and asks, "More importantly...is everyone alright? Please tell me I didn't step on someone by mistake..."

"Um, everyone's fine, Molly..." you answer back in both fear and awe. Kris is just in awe. Just as you start worrying about how she's going to stay anywhere at that size, Molly quickly shrinks down until she's back at her normal height of 8'6".

"Whew...thank goodness." Molly replies, breathing a sigh of relief.

"How did you DO that? Why didn't you say you could do that?" Kris asks almost uncontrollably.

"No one asked, and I didn't really think it that important until now..." Molly admits.
1532121211.title: Rumble in the urban jungle!

choices: The next day starts out normally.
You wake up to a surprise visitor...
15321212111.content:
With that violent rhino anthro having been dealt with for now, the way is now clear to continue on your way. The people around aren't exactly applauding Molly's efforts, but they're certainly talking about the fight. "That was totally awesome!" Mizuru exclaims happily and adds, "I gotta share that with my friends!"

"Eheh...I was kind of awesome back there, wasn't I?" Molly responds with a grin, enjoying the praise.

Eventually, the group reaches the pizzeria from earlier. It's less busy outside than it was when you left, but there's still a few people there. "Well, I'm parked here so that means this is my stop." Ryan announces, and then asks, "Er, by the way...are all of you capable of what Molly did back there?"

Tiberius shakes his head and replies, "No. If it is natural for our kind to be able to, it may be extremely rare."

"You...think this isn't natural?" Molly asks.

"I can't say. I can't even say if we're natural, period. I've been like this for perhaps a little over a year now, but I remember the change being overnight. And we're comprised of many animal species native to many different environments. Breeze, for example, was born a domesticated horse. Doesn't sound very natural, does it?"

"It isn't." Ryan concludes, and then says, "Question is then, what's causing this and why. Rhino-boy wasn't exactly talkative while you guys are happy to strike up a conversation. Might be something there." he scribbles something down on a piece of paper and hands it to Mizuru. "My address, if anyone wants it. Catch you guys later."

The bat anthro turns the paper over in her hand as Ryan left and asks puzzled, "Did...did he just hit on me?"

"He does this almost all the time." Kris informs her, "Still, it's handy to have in case you need to get in touch with him."

"Actually, that's not a bad idea. We know where you guys can usually be found at, it's only fair you know where to find us." you state, and then add, "And Molly, of course."

You and Kris give Mizuru your addresses for the sake of the whole group, and then you continue a bit farther to the store parking lot. Thankfully, the cars haven't been towed away. "So here we are. We'll be heading home." you say as you get to your car, "Take care!"

You unlock the door and enter your car. Molly crams herself into the passenger seat and you head for home. Soon enough, you arrive, and you once again help Molly get out of your car. "A convertible would be really nice...much more head room and all." she suggests.

"If you've got a few tens of thousands of dollars to drop on one, be my guest." you counter as you unlock your front door to go inside with your new toaster and Molly falls silent.

After you enter, you almost immediately unbox the new toaster and replace the old one with it. You sort through the mail, but find only bills or junk mail waiting. Then you stick a couple pieces of bread into the toaster to try it out. "Hungry for toast?" Molly asks, looking over your shoulder. Not that it's hard for her to do so.

"Gotta make sure this thing works. If not, then it's gotta go back." you reply. Sure enough, it works and a pair of golden brown toast pops up...and Molly steals one of the slices and gulps it down before you can do anything. Sighing, you butter the remaining slice and eat it before she considers taking that one too. Afterward, you work on a website for a client while she dives back into her book.

Later, you make dinner for both of you, then turn in for the night. A part of you wouldn't mind Molly sleeping with you, but your value for the ability to breathe should she roll over you wins out.
15321212111.title: Home time.

choices: Go for a walk, and learn more about Mizuru.
Take a trip to the park in town.
153212121112.content:
Morning comes, and you groggily wake up. You get up and head for the bathroom in the automatic preparation to take Molly outside, almost expecting her leash in her mouth. However, you find to your still-tired mind's surprise that the bathroom door is locked. "That's strange..." you mutter. A few moments later, you hear the door unlock as the doorknob turns and the door opens revealing a...bat-human hybrid creature? You let out a scream of shock.

"Gah! Ow! Volume down, fella! Sheesh..." the bat-girl replies while covering her ears. Quickly you stop and start instead blushing slightly as your brain finally snaps out of its stupor and remembers all the events of yesterday. Including the fact that Molly had little need for that leash and could just hand it to you with her own hands. You had met this bat yesterday; her name was Mizuru.

"O-oh. God I feel like an idiot. Sorry, Mizuru." you apologize. It's then you notice the 5'7" anthro is clad in nothing more than a bath towel, and that her fur was clinging closely to her body. It appears she had just gotten out of the shower. "Um, what are you doing here anyway, other than using my bathroom?" you ask.

"I wanted to check up on you guys after yesterday. I've been in this place since...I wanna say 6:00 in the morning? It was only around then that Molly actually let me in." Mizuru responds almost uncomfortably nonchalantly.

"Molly!" you yell, causing Mizuru to cover her ears again.

A somewhat loud thumping can be heard as Molly comes partly up the stairs and she responds tiredly, "I tried to make her wait for a more reasonable time before I'd let her in...but I couldn't bring myself to leave her there for more than an hour. Sorry."

"...Do you even sleep?" you ask Mizuru, stunned.

"Of course I do! It's kinda erratic, but I sleep!" she answers, then looks down at the bath towel she's wearing and asks, "Um, I suppose I shouldn't be using one of your towels, should I? But my clothes are still in the dryer..." finally, she says, "Well I guess I don't mind going around without anything on for a little while..."

"No, no, d-don't do that. You can keep the towel, I've got others." you inform her hastily. Her figure, while not nearly to the same level as Molly or Breeze's, is still what you'd consider well above average. However, you want to avoid the temptation of doing something stupid as much as you can. Better to leave that to Ryan and let him get subsequently beat up by a pissed-off bat anthro.

"Really? Thanks! I'll be sure to treasure it!" Mizuru exclaims happily and squeezes you into a bear hug, surprising you with her strength despite the lack of muscle definition on her smooth, slender arms. You also notice that her chest is...definitely firm through the bath towel as your slightly struggling lungs will attest. Finally she lets go and you rush into the bathroom to relieve your bladder before you end up wetting your pajama bottoms and subsequently making a fool of yourself.

You get dressed and head downstairs to make some breakfast. On that thought, it's clear to you that you should offer some for Mizuru, yet you've no idea what she likes to eat. Does she eat bugs like most bats do? Drink blood? As you enter the kitchen, you notice the distinct lack of Molly at the table reading a book like yesterday. A quick poke into the living room reveals her sprawled on the entire couch, feet hanging well off the one arm of it while her head rests on the other, fast asleep.

Letting the sleeping giant dog anthro beauty lie, you ask Mizuru, "Um...what exactly is it that you eat? Insects? Uh..."

Mizuru chuckles and finishes your question with, "Blood? What do I look like, a vampire? ...don't answer that." she then replies more seriously, "No, I don't drink that stuff. It's hard enough for us just to get the stuff we have without adding something like that to the list. I'm partial to fruit, but I can generally eat anything humans would...though I'd rather not eat bugs if I'm honest."

"Alright then. Bacon and eggs it is!" You announce and get started. A loud creak is heard as Molly shifts in her sleep on the couch in the living room. As you cook, you note with increasing annoyance the dark brown towel clad anthro girl hovering over your shoulder as much as she could until finally you say, "I don't mean to sound rude, but do you mind? I could hurt you or get hurt myself like this, and I'd prefer to do neither."

"Sorry!" Mizuru apologizes and backs off. A good thing too, as you're about to start the bacon. Once it's underway, the couch in the other room creaks loudly as Molly sits up and lets out a yawn. She stretches her arms, dangerously close to punching holes in the ceiling, and then she stands up, carefully stretching the rest of her body. Finally, she comes into the kitchen.

"Heh. I knew the smell of frying bacon would get your attention. Some things never change." you say teasingly.

"Except that I'm not going to have to beg for some of that...right?" she responds back smartly and you point to the extra plate set right where she had been seated yesterday.
153212121112.title: A stupidly early visitor...

1532121211121.content:
After breakfast, you load up the dishwasher and get it running. Normally, you'd take Molly for a walk right about now for some exercise. But then again, since yesterday your previous sense of normalcy has been thrown out the window... "Hey, Tom?" Molly asks, using your name to get your attention, "How about we go for that walk?"

You nod and answer, "Sure. I'd get your leash, but...I don't think you need it. Not to mention it probably doesn't fit."

"Can I come along?" Mizuru asks, practically pleading with her green eyes.

"I guess, but not like that."

"Well I meant once my clothes are done in the dryer, which should be right about..." the dryer buzzer goes off and Mizuru finishes with a grin, "...Now."

Mizuru rushes to the laundry room and retrieves her clothes from the dryer. When the bat anthro returns, she's decked out in the same outfit of a dark grey smiley face t-shirt and pink short skirt she was wearing yesterday. "Ah... So cozy warm when they come out!" she remarks contentedly.

The three of you head out the door and you lock it on the way. At first Molly easily takes a commanding lead with her roughly yard long walking strides, but she gives a pause to let you and Mizuru catch up. "So, how are things going over at the sanctuary? I hope Alex isn't still angry over what I said yesterday..." she asks.

"Oh, Breeze got him to cool down after you left. At least, that's what she told me when Tiberius and I returned. She's got a way with becalming nearly anyone, I think." Mizuru responds, "As for everything else...call me crazy, but the return trip we got a lot more stares."

"Oh no..."

"Hold on, these weren't fearful stares, but more along the lines of curiosity. I had a few people actually greeting me and asking my name when I went to see my friends later.
