I think your fight actually really helped to get it into their heads that we're not all out to harm them. Of course, a gigantic, utterly hot anthro yelling about a group not at all like that rhino is bound to stick in their heads." Mizuru explains, the last remark you swear makes Molly blush under the fur on her face.

As you walk, you find yourself curious about Mizuru and the origin of her name. "Say...where did you come up with your name?" you ask, completely expecting something like, 'oh, I thought it sounded nice.'

Instead, she sighs and answers, "It was given to me while I was still just a bat. I had gotten injured somehow, I don't really remember what exactly, and I ended up nearly starving because of it. Just as I was sure I was going to die, a girl found me and took me to her home. She nursed me back to health. Eventually she started calling me Mizuru and telling me about her day when she returned from school. Her family had moved here from Japan recently, so she didn't have many friends even though she was fluent in English...mostly."

"So what happened?" Molly asks.

"Well...her parents discovered she was keeping me without their permission. They released me while she was still in school, calling me a filthy beast. I had little choice but to leave. I found a nice little spot to roost, then I went for some food around sunset. Oddly, I felt very tired soon after, and the next day I woke up to a face full of dirt. I had become, well, like this."

"Weren't you in the slightest bit embarrassed about being naked?" you ask.

"Um, no. Why should I have been?" Mizuru replies casually, earning a snicker from Molly. Now that you think about it, of course they wouldn't be concerned about something that human society ingrains into itself from an early age. "Anyway, I wandered around until I met Tiberius. I've made quite a few friends since then, but...I've never tried to go back to see Rika. For all I know, her family may have moved back to Japan. I probably should at least try, just haven't found time to." she finishes.
1532121211121.title: Story of Mizuru's life.

choices: Just go and ask to meet yourself.
15321212111211.content:
You hadn't quite expected to get quite the story you did from Mizuru about her name. It was touching, really, if perhaps a little sad. You've never heard of this Rika girl before, but surely she'd like to know what became of the bat she took care of at the very least. Looking for a name would be like searching for a needle in a very large haystack, unless you had something else to narrow it down...

"So...this Rika girl... What's her last name? Do you remember the address?" you ask your bat anthro friend of less than 24 hours ago.

"Hm...Niwatori? Hitotsumori? Wannahuckaloogie? No, those aren't it..." Mizuru replies, trying to remember, then answers the other question with, "I don't exactly remember the address, but I do remember it being on a huge lot with a fancy gate out front. The house was pretty big looking too, much larger than yours."

"Wasn't there some Japanese guy donating a big check to a charity event in the news the other day?" Molly asks, her blue eyes staring down at you, "Or were you too busy looking at giantess stories from Kris again to pay attention?"

Crap. She had been reading those too before her transformation, or at least had some idea what it was that your childhood friend often emailed you. "I-I never ask her to send me those, she just does... But yeah, I remember that story. Kousei Narumi, president of a large business company in town that came in from its branch in Japan apparently. Why?"

Just as you ask that, Mizuru's eyes widen and she shouts, "That's it! Narumi! Rika Narumi!" she then adds, "So if her dad's this big businessman that was seen recently, then she might still be here after all!"

"Wait, if he's her father, then how come you didn't know that by now with him being in the news?" Molly asks, tilting her head slightly in confusion.

"Uh...eheh...we don't have a TV at the sanctuary..."

By now your feet are getting tired, so you stop and sit down on a bench near a bus stop. And almost immediately, a large shadow looms overhead as Molly parks herself directly behind you, placing her white furry hands just behind and to either side of your neck. Neither the 8'6" busty dog anthro nor the 5'7" bat anthro seem all that tired at all, but Mizuru takes a seat beside you regardless. The passersby give stares of intrigue at the sight, and some of the men give slightly jealous glances at you. Staring up Molly's arms past where the white changes to reddish brown just before her elbows and past her huge chest (a tricky task in more than one way) into the underside of her jaw, you ask, "Well? What do you think Molly?"

She looks down towards you and responds, "It's worth a try to get our friend to meet this girl again. I don't know how we're going to do it though. I mean, I guess I could break the gate down with my bare hands if need be, but that wouldn't leave a good impression."

"Really? Thanks guys! I'm glad to have such nice friends!" Mizuru exclaims happily, bringing both you and Molly into a tight embrace, which also squishes you into the latter's breasts somewhat. Thankfully, Molly doesn't seem to mind. Mizuru then asks her, "As for the gate, couldn't you just grow large enough to just simply walk over it and carry us over to the other side?"

"She could, but then we would be trespassing. That's a really bad thing." you remind.

"Oh right...just when our public image is seemingly starting to shift for the better. Tiberius would be pissed if one of us ruined it." Mizuru acknowledges sadly.

"Isn't there anyone who could help? Anthro or human?" Molly asks curiously.

"Well...we could try asking for Breeze to help."

"Or, you know, we could just ask if we could meet with Kousei at his estate. He might be interested." you suggest.
15321212111211.title: Reunion time.

choices: Turns out a search party isn't needed...
Tiberius helps assemble a search party for Rika.
153212121112112.content:
It's quickly decided that the best option was to get in contact with the Narumi family and try to arrange a meeting. Fortunately, Kris had a friend that works for the business company Kousei ran so you at least had a foot in the proverbial door. You need only get in touch with your childhood friend to pass the message down. Unfortunately, you had forgotten your phone at home and thus it has to wait until you get back.

"Aw shoot. Forgot my phone back at the house. Well, let's head back. Yes you can come too, Mizuru." you say, answering what you suspect would have been asked by the bat anthro before she can even ask it.

You get up off the bench and begin heading back. Mizuru happily follows, while Molly briefly sighs with disappointment at the walk being over so soon before easily catching up thanks to her much longer strides. The walk back is mostly uneventful aside from the few stares that your companions draw. Especially Molly with her 8'6" height and more than generous curves.

Once back at your place, the three of you head inside and you pick up the phone to call Kris. "Hello, Kris? It's Tom. Can you get your friend to try to arrange me a meeting with Kousei Narumi? ...I'm totally serious. It's for Mizuru. Alright, I'll hang on." you say over the phone. Kris puts you on hold for a few minutes, and then when she picks up again... "Well thanks anyway."

"I take it that's a no?" Molly asks judging from what you had just said over the phone.

"He's off today, and has specific instructions to not be contacted unless for a very good reason. Someone wanting to meet him doesn't count as such." you reply.

"So if we can't arrange for a meeting, then...how am I going to meet Rika again?" Mizuru questions and then says sadly, "I guess it's not going to happen. Thanks for at least wanting to help, guys..."

An idea strikes you. A crazy one, but what choice did you have at this time? "Hold on. There's nothing against going over to ask." you suggest, which makes the bat anthro's green eyes light up once more.

This time, you take the car to go out. "I call shotgun!" Mizuru says with enthusiasm.

"Um, I kind of won't fit in the back. At all. Sorry." Molly counters as she takes the front passenger seat.

"O-oh. Never mind then, I'll take the back..." she replies quietly and takes the back seat behind you. Soon enough, you're on your way into town. "Hey...what's this thing?" you hear Mizuru ask, holding up the bundled up old toaster.

"That? Junk of the kind I wouldn't wish on even my worst enemy. Was going to just throw it out." you answer her.

The trip takes a little longer than yesterday, but you pull up by the gate to the Narumi estate. You arrive just in time for a large, black limousine to come driving out. It stops and the rear window rolls down for the occupant to say, "If you're seeking business with me, I'm afraid it's going to have to wait. My daughter has run away from home and I need to find her before something bad happens to her." the window rolls back up and the limo drives off.

"Run away? But why? We've got to help find her. She could be in danger for all we know!" Mizuru says with great worry. You nod and head for the sanctuary. The eyes and ears of Tiberius and the others would surely be invaluable for this task, and this could help further improve the public image of this group of anthros.
153212121112112.title: A runaway situation?!

1532121211121121.content:
Of course, the Narumi estate and the sanctuary were quite a fair distance apart from one another. Not quite opposite ends of town far, but a trip that is made less pleasant by the situation as it stands...and Molly starting to show her discomfort in being crammed into a space that was never meant for an 8'6" tall humanoid to be in, attractive or no. To make matters worse, the street where the fight took place yesterday against that rhino anthro was closed due to construction, thus requiring an alternate path to your destination. It also had the effect of raising tensions and fears within the car. Every second wasted could mean this Rika girl was that much more likely of being lost forever, or worse.

Finally, you reach the sanctuary building. You park your car within one of the limited amount of spaces provided, not that any of them are occupied, and then exit the vehicle with your passengers. Molly comes ever so close to just breaking the passenger side door clear off its hinges in her effort to escape what surely must feel almost like a sardine can to her and then proceeds to arch and stretch her back as far as she could go, muzzle (and to a slightly lesser extent, breasts) pointed to the sky. Mizuru just gets out pretty normally by comparison, though her smile is missing due to her worry.

You approach the door and Mizuru attempts to open it, only to find the door locked. "Weird... Usually it's unlocked." she calls out, "Hey, Tiberius! Anyone! Open the door! We've got something serious to deal with!"

Tiberius opens the door, his white visage actually fairly comforting, and says as he steps out, "Indeed? Is it another attack? You've found another anthro like us? Otherwise, I fear we're already in the midst of handling a situation..." a girl's cry can be heard from inside, "...albeit poorly."

"Wait, why are you guys keeping a girl here against her will?" Molly asks as she approaches the door and Tiberius allows the whole group inside.

"We've little choice at this time. We found her wandering the streets alone and apparently lost. We're keeping her here for her own safety until we can find out where she lives at which point we'll return her to her parents. As well as being relatively easy to keep track of her until then." the white tiger anthro replied, clearly unhappy about the situation.

You enter the common room and see Alex watching a young Japanese girl with crossed arms. "Aw, come on... You think I'm enjoying this? And stop staring at me like you'd like to turn me into a pile of steak!" he said to her. By your estimate, she's about 5'2" in height and roughly 14 or 15 years old. If her clothes with their high-end designer labels were anything to go by, this girl generally had a fair bit of money at her disposal.

The girl at first glared more intensely at the bull, then went wide-eyed as Molly entered the room. "Holy cow..." she managed as Molly straightened up, her ears naturally brushing the ceiling. "She's..." the girl starts. While there's a clear hint of a Japanese accent in her voice, her English is virtually flawless. So far.

Alex turned his head a little and nodded, saying, "...Big? Yeah, I'm sure she gets that a lot. Hey, Molly. And...uh...you never did introduce yourself the other day did you?"

"It's Tom." you inform Alex and then ask the girl, "What's your name?"

"I'll tell if you let me go...like anyone cares who I am anyway..." is her rather pessimistic response.

Mizuru listens from behind you, Molly, and Alex, out of sight. Just as you're about to ask why the girl thinks that way, the bat anthro says from behind, "You've still never really made any friends over here, have you...Rika Narumi?"

The girl perks up at the name, almost involuntarily. There was no mistaking it: this was Rika Narumi, the daughter of Kousei Narumi, and the very person you and Molly had been hoping to help Mizuru reunite with after hearing her story. "...No, I haven't. But who's asking? How did you even know my name?" she admits and asks, confused.

It's at this time that Mizuru steps out into the open and says with some caution, "A friend of sorts from a few months ago. That's both who and how."

Rika takes a moment to think about the reply she's received. Finally it begins to dawn on her... "No. Way. M-Mizuru?! Is...is that really you?!" she asks, wide-eyed. When Mizuru responds with a smile and a nod, Rika responds with a very surprised, "...Holy CRAP!"

Her next response takes you and the anthros in the room by surprise.
1532121211121121.title: A fortunate surprise!

choices: Kosei decides to assist the anthros.
Kosei doesn't approve of Rika's friends.
15321212111211211.content:
"But...how? How did this happen? Ah, you know what? Who CARES?! This is so incredibly awesome!" Rika says, running up to Mizuru and hugging her with everything she can manage. Mizuru does the same in return, until... "Ack! Miz...Mizuru...crushing...ribs..."

"He he...oops. Sorry. Gotta be more careful about that..." Mizuru apologizes sheepishly as she relents.

"She is pretty strong when you consider her arms don't even look toned much less muscular. I'd hate to arm wrestle with her..." you comment.

"And what about me? Would you care to arm wrestle with me?" Molly asks with an amused giggle.

"Um...hell no. Even if I had a chance at beating you fair and square you'd totally cheat!" you answer back teasingly. Of course you have no idea if she actually would cheat by any means, but considering she's 2 and a half feet taller than you and most definitely outweighs you by a startling margin, Molly would have your arm pinned to the table almost immediately after 'Three!' without really trying. To be honest, you'd rather not arm wrestle with any anthro here.

"Well well! Seems like you've got some use after all, Mizuru! And here I thought we'd have to send for Breeze to break the girl!" Alex says with a joking grin.

"W-wha? Break me? I thought that cat said you guys wouldn't do that! The liar!" Rika responds, a little upset. "I guess this Breeze guy is some elephant that would grind my bones for fun, then. Rather ironic name..."

"Well, actually...Alex meant get info out of you." Mizuru corrects, "Ti is pretty serious about not harming humans unless out of absolute necessity, and our rep is only just now starting to turn positive. Also...Breeze is possibly the prettiest mare you'd lay eyes on, and as gentle as her name implies. You know, now that I think about it I've never visited her before..."

"Oh..."

A few minutes later, after being given the rundown of them vs. the violent anthros like the rhino Molly fought by Tiberius, Rika is enthusiastically becoming acquainted with the others, including Alex, while also taking a tour of the sanctuary. Given what little you know about her, she seems happy to be making so many friends even if they aren't human. Commendable, really. You notice that she appears to be making it a point to keep away from Molly. Was she scared of her because of her size? Or was there something else? Maybe she just didn't like dogs... "Um, excuse me, but...is there some reason you're avoiding Molly here?" you ask.

"O-oh! Er...no. I was just wanting to save her for last. Well, second last I guess." Rika replies but then adds, "...Ugh. Total baka moment here...I just realized how dumb that sounds when more could be out there even now!"

"Baka?" you ask in confusion.

"'Idiot'."

"What did you just call me?!"

"No! I meant 'idiot' is what baka means in Japanese!" she hastily corrects, "Anyway...um, Molly was it? Could you..."

"Kneel down for you? Just a guess." Molly answers as she gets into said kneeling position.

"Well I uh...yeah. That's much better now that I'm not practically staring at either your hips or under your boobs..." Rika admits, blushing slightly. "It's nice to meet you, Molly. I saw you in the news yesterday, and I gotta say that was really cool how you got huge and totally Rider Kicked that brutish rhino guy! ...Also, I don't know if anyone's told this to you, but...you're really beautiful." she holds out her hand and asks, "Um, can I pet you? I understand if you're beyond such a thing, but..."

"Well thank you, Rika! Someone has told me that now. And of course you may!" Molly replies happily, and bends down a bit more to let Rika reach her head easier. The girl reaches up and pets Molly on the head, then proceeds to scratch just behind her ears. Molly groans softly with content until Rika stops, who seems utterly delighted.

"So...um...I guess we should be getting you back to your dad, then. He's gone out looking for you..." Mizuru says somewhat sadly. "I think he's genuinely worried sick about you."

Rika seems a bit hesitant, then replies, "Yeah, I guess you're right. Anyone mind if I get my father to come here?" when no one objected, she sends a text message with her phone.

Ten minutes later, there's a knock at the door in some sort of pattern. You approach and open the door to find a rather displeased Kosei Narumi on the other side. "Explain what you have done with my daughter before I have you arrested. Why was I asked to come to this abandoned building. Where is my Rika?" he asks coldly. For a man roughly the same height as Mizuru, he's certainly imposing.

Unsure what to say, you lead him inside. Rika smiles and waves at her father, who is instantly relieved to see her. "Afternoon, father! You're alone, like I instructed?" she says happily.

"You sent that message yourself?!" Kosei answers, turning to shock at what she's done.

"Well, I didn't want police involvement. I found Mizuru, father! Remember the bat I was nursing back to health that mother had tossed out a few months ago? I found her - or should I say, she found me?" Rika explains.

"That's nice, dear, but..."

"I am...a bit different from how you're remembering me, I'm sure." Mizuru replies as she comes to stand beside Rika happily. "There's more of my kind here that Rika's befriended as well!"

Kosei is stunned at the sight of Mizuru as she takes and shakes his hand, remembering to not squeeze too hard. "Y-your kind?" he manages.

"Yes. Our kind. Anthros." Alex says as he and Tiberius enter with a few others. "...Uh, maybe you ought to sit down before you fall down and hurt yourself, sir. This is our sanctuary. It's not very much, but we've come this far with it."

"And now, for something that will blow your socks off, father! I'd like you to meet a very big friend of mine and Tom's, the man I hope you didn't threaten at the door because of me. And Mizuru's as well, of course." Rika announces, and Kosei's eyes widen at the sight of Molly as she approaches. "I did mention she's very big."

Molly waves her hand and says, "Hello! I'm Molly! Yes, this is my normal height, all eight feet six inches of it. Yes, these," she points to her massive breasts. "Are real. Your daughter has an expert hand for right where a girl likes it...behind the ears, of course."
15321212111211211.title: Rika and Mizuru - BFF!

choices: He refuses to let Rika go.
He lets Rika go with her friend tomorrow.
153212121112112111.content:
Kosei could scarcely believe it. He had heard rumors of creatures that looked like humanoid animals, and that they were hostile, but he thought nothing of it. Then the breaking news yesterday made him believe that the news station was unscrupulously trying to cash in on the rumors in order to boost their ratings. Now, he has very... irrefutable evidence that these anthros are very much real and that Molly especially is real.

There's also the matter of his daughter, Rika. Since they moved from Japan, she's been incredibly lonely. She learned English very quickly and fluently, which he expected no less from her, (not that it didn't make him feel like a proud father just the same) but hadn't made any friends over here. She's always liked animals, contrary to her mother, and has befriended this group of anthros. Including Mizuru, the bat she had been nursing back to health. She certainly looks more than healthy now, and both you and Kosei had a hunch that Rika and Mizuru are effectively inseparable now - they would remain best friends whether her father approved or not. But he did in fact approve of them, for he's happy for his daughter to finally have friends, and be willing to give them a chance.

"I-incredible... Pleased to meet you.. all of you." Shakily, he offers his hand, and Molly takes it in her own to give a firm yet gentle handshake. Tiberius is next, and then Alex with some hesitation. Finally, Mizuru accepts the handshake, remembering to be careful.

"Father, they need our help." Rika says a few minutes later.

"We do?" Tiberius asks, the first time you've heard him sound so uncertain.

"Yes, you do, kitty cat. You've no computers, thus no internet access. No TV. No newspaper or radio. No media connection to the outside world at all. We're not expecting the latest and greatest toys that a geek would drool over here, just something to be able to keep up with what's going on in the world we're all sharing. And do you even really want to have to rely on hand-me-outs, or would you like to be able to earn what you want and need for yourselves?" Rika informs him bluntly.

"Well... no." Tiberius admits finally.

"I see what my daughter is getting at. I may be able to call in a few favors to assist in the matter. If you're willing, I can offer employment for some of you as well." Kosei says in response as he thinks it over.

"While they may be lacking in the usual qualifiers for hiring... I think they're more than willing to try and learn on the job." you comment, which several of the anthros in the room nod in response.

For the next few minutes, Tiberius brings Rika's father up to speed on their history and what they've faced. Kosei listens intently, considering where some of the best spots for their employment may be for PR purposes that could benefit the anthros as well as his company. He was also surprised and shocked to find out they had no idea how or why they had turned into humanoid beings. You confirmed that you woke up to find Molly as the towering, busty, and very intelligent anthro she is just yesterday morning. "What does it matter that they don't know how they came to be this way?" Rika asks.

"Well, actually... it would be kind of nice to have some of these answers. Like, if there's something out there that turns animals into anthros, how did we all become exposed to it? And how come Molly is so huge, and able to grow and return to her normal size at will?" Mizuru replies thoughtfully.

"A few DNA samples can potentially offer some insight as to what has changed. I'm particularly interested in Ms. Molly here for this." Kosei comments.

"Okay... Why me, though?" Molly questions in response.

"As you were a pet dog before your... transformation, I assume the vet you've frequented in the past may have something more direct to compare to. Another anthro of a domesticated animal could be beneficial as well, like a horse."

"Wait, did you say a horse? I think that can be easily arranged tomorrow! ...uh, sir." Mizuru says enthusiastically. "Rika is more than welcome to come along, if that's alright with you."
153212121112112111.title: A business venture.

1532121211121121112.content:
Kosei thinks it over for a few minutes. He could certainly use his daughter Rika's help, and is hesitant to let her go... but on the other hand she's rarely gone out anywhere since they moved here. Ultimately, he answers Mizuru with, "I... guess that is fine."

Rika cheers at the news. Sure, she's nervous about going, but she was going with her friend Mizuru, and that excites her almost to no end. Soon though it was time for her to say goodbye, and the Narumis left for home. "Nice girl, that Rika. She really is." Molly comments, rising to her full height. "Perhaps your friends might like to take the trip as well?" she then suggests to you.

"Hey, that's a great idea!" Mizuru says happily, and then adds, "...Er, provided Ryan doesn't do anything weird."

"We'll see. You can feel free to correct him if he gets on your nerves, he could use the ass kicking." you say casually. You don't think Ryan would cause trouble, but even you can't predict what he's going to do all the time.

"A-alright..." the bat anthro replies with obvious hesitance in her voice.

Eventually, you and Molly head for home in order to prepare for this trip. First though is a side trip to the store for a much larger welcome mat for those muddier days so Molly can at least wipe her paws off before tracking stuff that really shouldn't be tracked through the house. The old one was about worn out anyway, bringing to light that they simply didn't make them like they used to anymore. You replace the mat as soon as you get home, and you get the feeling any anthro that visits may approve of the new welcome mat.

Later that afternoon, after having called both Kris and Ryan to see if they were busy tomorrow and if they wanted to go on a trip Mizuru was planning, you and Molly were watching TV. Before, she'd lie in your lap watching the screen while you pet her, but now... that wasn't really an option. Still, you feel your arm being gently lifted to behind her head so you could scratch behind her ears. You're slightly surprised to feel her head feeling much different than you remember. It feels almost like human hair. Sure enough, with her sitting down next to you, you can see some of the fur around her head extending further and noticeably more red than the rest did around it, curling a bit above her shoulders. Now that you think about it, Mizuru had almost black hair extending down behind her head as well...

Just then, the doorbell rings. "I'll get it." Molly offers, getting up off the couch to head for the door. You turned the volume down just a bit so you could hear what was being said. "Can I help you, sir? ...H-hang on..." you hear, and then, "Tom! Come here for a minute!"

Getting up off the couch, you make your way to the door and find a very well dressed man... looking very startled. "I beg your pardon, sir, but I was instructed by my master to offer you and your... large lady friend a formal invite to his estate. I've also been instructed to give these to Ms. Molly, though they seem absurdly large..." he says politely.

"I'm absurdly large." Molly responds pointedly as she reaches for the material the man is holding.

"When are we to be there, should we accept?" you ask as Molly slips off to check out what she's been given.

"Er, as soon as you're able. He's arranged for your pick up, along with Ms... Misuri?"

"Mizuru?"

"Yes, Ms. Mizuru! My master's daughter was especially adamant about her invitation."

You think it over carefully before finally saying, "Give us a few minutes to get ready."

"Of course, sir." the man answers politely and you leave to gather a few things. Namely your phone and laptop.

On the way back to the door, you're confronted by Molly wearing a simple outfit of a sleeveless shirt and a pair of shorts that somehow allow her tail to fit through the back. "This is actually quite comfortable! I can't wait to show Mizuru how I look in this!" she says happily as you walk together.

The two of you head outside and the limo driver opens the back doors to allow you and the man you assume to be the Narumi estate's butler inside. Once inside, you spot Mizuru also aboard. "Hey Tom! Hey Molly!" she greets.

"You told them where we live, didn't you?" Molly asks.

"Of course. When I got the invitation, since Ti mentioned you guys having already gone home, I told them where they could find you when they asked. ...Was that wrong of me to do that?"

"No, no, it's fine. By the way, how do you like this outfit I just got?"

"It fits you to a T, Molly!" Mizuru replies genuinely with a smile.
1532121211121121112.title: Arrangements are made.

choices: The next day, the trip to Breeze!
15321212111211211121.content:
Naturally, the ride in the limo is a bit cramped for Molly, but it's not nearly as bad as in your car. The butler seems to be the most uncomfortable one in the vehicle, which you assume is only because this is his first time around anthros. "Come now, sir, neither of us are gonna reach over and bite ya... Your master wouldn't put you in danger, would he?" Mizuru says, trying to calm the man down.

"I-I suppose not, m-miss..." he admits somewhat hesitantly, even as the limo pulls into the opened gates of the Narumi estate. Past the gates, while still quite an expansive place compared to yours, it's much more modest than ones you've seen on TV.

Once the car comes to a stop, the driver opens the door to allow its passengers out. The butler opens the door and allows you, Mizuru, and Molly inside. You're quickly taken aback at how clean everything is as you're lead to a room. "Sir, the guests you had requested to be invited are here." the butler says to the room's current occupants.

"Ah, thank you, Ronald. Megumi is requesting your services when you have a moment." Kosei says, and then turns to you and the anthros to say, "Glad that you could make it. Consider this in part an apology for my... earlier behavior. It also gives us a chance to get things organized for tomorrow and concerning the anthros, if you don't mind of course."

"O-of course not, Mr. Narumi!" you respond.

"How about a bit of a tour, Molly? You too, Mizuru!" Rika offers them, to which they agree and the three leave. You follow, figuring no one would mind if you tagged along.

As the tour progresses, Mizuru is practically enthralled by nearly everything she sees. "Didn't you live here before?" Molly asks.

"Just in Rika's room, and my eyesight wasn't nearly as good back then. Not to mention not getting a good glimpse of much when I got thrown out and called a filthy beast." Mizuru answers.

"Sorry about that." Rika says as the tour continues.

Eventually, the tour culminates with the kitchen, where Ronald and an older Japanese woman you assume is Kosei's wife Megumi are preparing dinner. "Ah, Rika! I was about to ask you what we should have for our guests, and..." Megumi says before noticing the two anthro ladies entering the room behind Rika and yourself. "What are these filthy things doing here?" she asks with confusion and clear revulsion.

"Excuse me? We're guests here, ma'am. And I am not a filthy beast! My name is Mizuru." the bat anthro answers angrily.

Molly steps forward and picks up the 5'5" woman with little effort, making her turn very pale with fear. "We were invited here at the behest of your husband. I expect Mizuru will be coming here often, so I'd suggest getting used to her and the rest of our kind. Are we good?" she says and asks. When Megumi nods, Molly gently lowers her back down to the floor and replies smiling, "Good!"

After Megumi quickly excused herself, Rika shook her head saying, "Again, I'm sorry about this. I was hoping she wouldn't be so rude, but she still stubbornly hates anything 'unclean', which in her mind includes animals. And seemingly anthros. Maybe the scare will bring some sense to her."

"I... see. Well, I guess I should get to helping your father with organizing tomorrow, then." you say.

"Not a problem. I've already got my outfit for tomorrow picked out, something mother won't kill me for getting dirty, and I know father appreciates the help you can offer."

A few hours later, most of tomorrow's plans have been made. The plans for integrating the anthros into Kosei's company's workforce are also well underway. Then dinner time comes and everyone beholds a feast befit a king. "Um... wow. That... that's a lot of food..." Rika remarks, giving the idea this isn't normal for the family. Both Molly and Mizuru closely watch everyone else start on the meal before digging in themselves, quickly picking up the proper etiquette for the table.

"Whew... I'm the biggest one here, and I don't think I could stuff any more down..." Molly sighs contentedly after the meal was finished. There's still a fair amount of food left over. By the late evening, Ronald leads you and Molly to a guest bedroom to spend the night while Mizuru goes to sleep with Rika at the girl's insistence.
15321212111211211121.title: At the Narumi estate...

153212121112112111211.content:
In the morning, you feel someone poking you in the side - a big someone. "Ugh... Five more minutes, Molly..." you groan in protest.

In response, Molly's large, fuzzy hand reaches down and pulls your eyelids open. "Oh no. You're getting up now, mister! We wouldn't want to give Mr. Narumi the impression that you're a lazy-bones, would we?" she responds, smiling.

"...I hate you." you grumble.

"No you don't." Molly replies back, smile widening even further as you sigh with defeat. You get up and stretch, then try to straighten your hair before heading out of the room.

A little ways down the hall, Rika says, "Well good morning! I trust the beds were comfy enough? Father's already gone to work, in case you were wondering."

"Yeah, like sleeping on a cloud." you respond as Molly steps out of the guest bedroom. "Um, where's Mizuru?"

"She's in my room, trying out my Wii U. I think I created a monster..." Rika responds, looking away.

"Oh, come ON! Stupid flying lizard!" you hear Mizuru scream from a ways down the hall as she comes out. "Just wait... once I actually learn what I'm doing, that Charizard's done for!"

"...Did I mention the game was Super Smash Bros. for Wii U?"

After a few minutes, you and the three girls head into the kitchen for perhaps the grandest breakfast you've experienced in your up until a few days ago painfully average life. Once done, you're escorted to the limo in order to be taken to where Breeze lives. "Anyone know her address, by any chance?" Molly asks inquisitively.

"Um... well... I think she mentioned a horse farm just outside town. Does that help?" Mizuru replies hesitantly.

"I do believe that may be of some use, miss." the driver says politely as the limo pulls out onto the road. You're not sure exactly how such seemingly vague information can be of help to locate where Breeze calls home, but if the driver thought it good enough... who are you to say anything against this?

The better part of an hour later, the limo comes to a stop a short distance from a house, with a large stable close by. You and the others get out and walk to the house. You knock on the door before a voice calls out from inside, "Give me a minute! I'll be right with you!" Soon the door opens and a fairly average looking man with straw colored hair opens the door. "I help you, sir? I'm afraid I don't have any horses for sale at the moment for the girl, if that's what you're here for."

"We're here to see a certain mare, actually. You're Peter, right?" Mizuru states, bringing attention to herself and Molly.

"I am. And you must be Mizuru and... crap... uh... Molly. Breeze is in the stables with the other horses." Peter answers, nodding.

Peter leads the group towards the stables, pushing the door open. There's four horses of varying colors poking their heads out of the openings in their respective stables. "Maximus, Phaedra, Billy, Biscuit, Breeze." Molly reads the nameplates of each as she passes, having to crouch a little to avoid hitting the ceiling. Rika reaches out to pet one of the horses.

Breeze's head poked out of her stable at the sound of all the commotion and looks around before asking in her sweet, English accented voice, "Master, you surely aren't thinking of selling any of your horses, are you?"

"N-no! Mizuru and Molly are here to visit you. And stop calling me 'master'! I've told you to call me Peter!" Peter responds flustered.

Soon after, everyone heads outside while Peter lets the horses out into the enclosure. It is then that Rika gets to behold the snow white anthro mare in all her glory. "Oh wow, you really weren't kidding about her, Mizuru... She's beautiful!" she remarks in slight awe.

The comment doesn't go unnoticed, however, as Breeze turns her ears then her head and finally the rest of her body towards Rika before looking down. "Oh, um, thank you! Can I ask you your name?" Breeze asks, kneeling down and causing her barely-adequate top to protest against the huge furred globes behind them... not to mention her tight shorts that hid next to nothing.

"I'm Rika Narumi. I took care of Mizuru before she became... well, what she is today." Rika answers happily.
153212121112112111211.title: The Breeze farm

1532121211121121112112.content:
"Wait a minute... Narumi?! As in the Narumi family that made that large charity donation a few days ago?!" Peter asks, dumbfounded.

"Yep, that's my father. We're currently looking into incorporating anthros into my father's company's workforce, even if that kitty cat Tiberius wasn't so convinced that they needed assistance initially." Rika responds, nodding.

"W-well! Th-that's certainly an honorable goal... but surely you haven't come all this way j-just to see Breeze, right?"

"We're hoping that a DNA sample along with her past medical records might help solve the mystery of why we've become like this." Molly answers and then adds, "I've been asked for the same thing."

"To see what's changed in us, correct? I think it sounds reasonable..." Breeze muses while allowing Rika to pet her.

Suddenly, the surroundings fall deathly quiet. Birds fly away from the trees, as though something has disturbed them. Then the sound of something big lumbering towards the farm can be heard. "I've got a bad feeling we're not alone out here..." you say nervously.

As Mizuru is about to respond, a large anthro shark bursts out from the woods, heading towards the group... albeit not as smoothly as the rhino from the other day had been moving. One thing was very clear aside from the size - this anthro was female. Perhaps she was having trouble due to being out of the water? As this apparently violent shark gets closer, she appears to be homing in on... Rika.

"Stay away from her!" Mizuru yells, attempting to get in the way of the 25 foot tall anthro. For her troubles, the shark swats her aside almost effortlessly, yet still seems to stumble a little.

As the shark lunges to try and devour the teenage Japanese girl, Molly grabs the shark's jaws with her hands. "I'm going to have to deal with you, aren't I? Why are you after a friend of mine?" she asks, annoyed.

The shark grunts, and tries to get rid of Molly, only to find her getting larger and larger by the second. Soon she's thrown back and now faces a 35 foot tall Molly. The shark now lunges for the larger dog anthro but receives a punch to the mouth instead. She takes a moment to spit out a number of broken teeth, which vanish as they presumably shrink down to their normal size. "Oh my..." Breeze remarks in alarm, the busty mare doing her best to get Rika and Mizuru out of harm's way. You and Peter are both well out of the way.

"Come on, the rhino was a better fighter than you!" Molly taunts, and then notices her clothes haven't torn off her and still fit just fine. "Huh... Sweet." she remarks.

The moment's distraction is all that's needed for the shark to headbutt Molly and knock her to the ground. Fortunately, the border collie anthro is thoughtful enough to keep herself from accidentally crushing anything beneath her, especially the horses. The shark moves in apparently for the kill... but stops just short of trying to crush her prey's windpipe. Why you don't know, but it's enough time for Molly to deliver a kick to the abdomen and get back up. She then charges in and gives a swift uppercut to the shark's jaw, knocking her to the ground.

"Alright... let's go over this again. Why are you after Rika Narumi?" Molly demands, pinning the shark to the ground. When the shark begins to shrink down, Molly accidentally hits her in the head as she follows suit. It's not long before the border collie is back to her usual 8'6" self, albeit incredibly muddy, but the shark continues until about 6'2" in height.

"That... that was scary, but so totally awesome!" Rika says as she and the others come out of hiding and then remarks, "Though you're seriously going to need to get cleaned up before you go anywhere, girl."

"No kidding... Strange though. That shark had me there for a moment. She could have killed me no problem, and yet she... I don't know... froze. I distinctly remember the rhino not doing that." Molly answers.

"How did one of those violent ones get here though? Especially one that's like a great white. The ocean's miles away!" Peter wonders aloud.

"Well maybe having her ass handed to her will make our fishy girl more more talkative?" Mizuru suggests, and everyone turns their attention to where the shark was last spotted. Luckily, she still seems to be there and is just now coming to.
1532121211121121112112.title: Farmyard brawl

15321212111211211121122.content:
"...Ugh... W-where am I?" the shark groans, rubbing her silvery blue haired head. She's very lean, built much like a swimming athlete... albeit one with above average breasts. Her sharp teeth are slightly disconcerting, however.

"Oh good, you do speak." Molly says, "and you're sitting in the middle of Peter and Breeze's horse farm."

"I... I think it's starting to come back to me... The human girl! I didn't..." the shark anthro says, looking around desperately. You've no idea what's going on, but she's acting completely different than before. For starters, she's showing emotions, something she wasn't earlier. And seems to be rather nervous. Then again, facing someone who towers over two feet over you could do that.

"Over here, sharkie. Angry you failed to kill me?" Rika speaks up, unsure whether this is an act or not.

"...Actually, I'm happy I didn't. That would make the ones behind the violent ones very happy, and I don't want the bastards to have their way, especially now that they're not controlling me like a puppet."

This information catches everyone's attention. "S-so the reason the violent ones don't listen to reason... is because they can't?" Breeze asks, bringing her hand to her muzzle in disbelief.

Cautiously, the shark stands up and nods, replying, "Essentially, yeah."

Half an hour later, everyone begins to slowly normalize. Molly has gotten herself all cleaned up, and while most are still... apprehensive around the shark anthro, she's done nothing to hurt her case. Breeze offers her a few apples, which she accepts with some hesitation.

"Hey, um... do you have a name we can call you by?" Mizuru asks carefully, taking a seat next to the one who just half an hour earlier swatted her aside as though she wasn't worth bothering with.

"They don't give names to their puppets/weapons... I guess it makes us easier to control if we don't have any sense of individuality. Nothing to cling onto. However... I remember being called Kayla some point before all of this, and I kind of like it, so..."

"I think Kayla is a wonderful name!" Breeze beams, smiling wide before embracing Kayla in a hug.

It's not long, however, before the shark is attempting to break free of the suffocation from having her head stuck in Breeze's cleavage. "G-gee, thanks, Breeze... But, um, I could use a little warning before you hug me again..." Kayla says carefully.

"Oh! Sorry!" Breeze responds, letting Kayla's head out of her considerable chest. The mare completely fails to notice you or Peter doing your best to look away from the admittedly arousing scene, for whatever reason.

Later, you arrange to pick up Molly's records from the vet while Peter gets Breeze's in order. The more difficult part is getting blood from the anthros now. As it turns out, their skin is very puncture resistant. Eventually, samples are taken from both.

"So, should I be worried about my father possibly being attacked?" Rika asks as preparations are being made to head back.

"I don't know for sure, but I don't think they would today anyway. They'll want to analyze their major loss, as they're not going to be happy to lose me or failed to turn your father against anthros by killing you, and try to ensure they don't lose another puppet before going forward with another attack." Kayla answers with some thought.

"Why though?" you ask.

"I think they fear humans and anthros working together." Kayla suggests, and then asks, "Um, if it isn't too much to ask... Could I go back with you guys? I don't really have anywhere to go..."

"Well, Tiberius probably won't object, so why not? Besides, I'm sure he's going to find what you know very interesting." Mizuru answers, shrugging her shoulders.

"I don't know as much as I'd like to be able to share, but I'll be sure to tell what I can." Kayla replies with a happy, toothy smile. For the first time in her life as an anthro, she's in control of herself. At least, as far as you know. This could all still be some elaborate trap, but somehow you doubt it. Still, it begs the question: who are the ones in control of the violent ones?
15321212111211211121122.title: Kayla's surprising revelations!

153212121112112111211221.content:
A few minutes later, and pulling Kayla away from the horses as the anthro shark tries to pet them, everyone is ready to leave. Kayla seems quite visibly excited - and enthralled at the sight of the limousine. "Wow, so that's your method of transportation... Cool!" she says.

"Yeah, though I've also got a bicycle. And it's actually the family's limo." Rika responds as she gets inside followed by yourself and the anthro ladies.

"A... bicycle. That's a two wheeled vehicle that you pedal, right?" Kayla asks with interest.

"It is." Rika answers, not sure why the shark was asking such a thing.

The ride continues like this until the limo arrives at the sanctuary a little while later, with Kayla's apparent enthusiasm only increasing. Outside are a few trucks that Alex and Tiberius are helping to unload. The humans apparently delivering the goods are clearly nervous around them, but are grateful for the assistance. Everyone steps out of the limo for the moment at least, where one of the workers comes up and says, "Ah! Ms. Narumi! Th-this is the correct address for this stuff, is it not? If I'm honest, these... creatures give me the creeps. Especially the tiger-like one..."

"Yes, this is the right address, and you've absolutely nothing to fear from Tiberius. He may look like a fierce tiger, but he's really just a big kitten." Rika responds reassuringly, then adds, "Oh, and they're called anthros, not creatures. Wouldn't want to insult future employees of my father's company, would you?"

"Er... n-no, Ms. Narumi!"

"Good. My father and I are convinced they deserve the chance to live the kinds of lives we take for granted. Part of that is respect."

The man nods in understanding, and then looks up towards the source of the looming shadow, that of course being Molly. She gives him a polite smile and a friendly wave hello, but it does little to ease his fears towards the towering, buxom anthro dog. "Alright, what's left to bring in? I may have had a knock-down drag-em-out earlier, but I'm still in good enough shape to help out."

"Actually, we just brought in the last of it. Sorry!" Alex answers.

"A fight? Is everyone alright?" Tiberius asks upon hearing of the fight.

"Yeah, Breeze saw to it everyone was safe. The shark nearly had me, though..." Molly replies.

"A... shark anthro?"

"Yes. Her, in fact. Kayla, this is Tiberius. Tiberius, Kayla." Molly answers, and then pulls Kayla into view, keeping a hold of her wrist so that the 6'2" shark anthro can't try to flee.

"Er... h-hi there..." Kayla says nervously, waving her free hand.

"Perhaps we should carry this conversation on inside..." Tiberius suggests, feeling it might put the delivery men at greater ease.

A few moments later, nearly everyone is inside to continue the conversation. "So, explain yourself. Please." Tiberius asks, sternly.

"Um, well, I was being controlled to kill Rika in order to try and turn her dad against us anthros and Molly stopped me. I don't remember exactly what she did, apart from knocking a bunch of my teeth out, but somehow they've lost control over me." Kayla answers, clearly very nervous.

"So then even the rhino we've encountered a few times has been merely a puppet for an unseen force?"

"I guess? We're denied a lot of things you and humans enjoy... identities... social interactions... anything that can even charitably be described as food... They want to control our bodies, but our minds are worthless to them."

Tiberius' face flips from looks of horror, to disgust, and even held back rage begging for release before his white and black striped face returns to its usual calm composure as he says, "My god... I... I'm not sure what to say about this other than how much I'm really disliking this... entity or entities that are behind all of this." the tiger pauses for a few seconds before asking, "Could someone bring Rika in here for a moment?"

"I'll do it." Molly answers, ducking outside to avoid bumping her head on the door frame. It's not very long before she returns, closely followed by the Japanese girl.

"You wanted to see me, kitty-cat?" Rika asks.

"We have a hidden foe that's using my kind as weapons, tools for destruction. I believe that it is our duty to inform your father of this, make him aware of the dangers."

"I hate to worry him, but I agree that he needs to know. Perhaps we can spin this in our favor? I've also been thinking about Kayla... She could provide some insight as to how these terrorists control their puppets - and more importantly, how we can cut the strings before things get too costly both with property damage and potential lives lost." Rika answers, looking towards the surprised shark anthro. "And we'll get you something nice to wear as well."
153212121112112111211221.title: Return to sanctuary

choices: Something interesting is found in the tests...
Problems arise with one or more test?
1532121211121121112112211.content:
Kayla slowly nods and says shakily, "I-if you think it'll help, then I'll go through with it. But, um... when are we going to do that?"

Rika answers, turning to look into the shark's amber eyes, "Very shortly. Just got to help get these guys all set up." and with that, the girl gets to work. Admittedly, some of the new things she and her father had brought in are nicer than the stuff you have at home. You're... not quite sure how to feel about that, but you help out showing how everything works. Most of the anthros are enthralled by the demonstrations, hanging on to every word said. Soon enough, they're given the chance to try out the new computers and TV, which they seem to get the hang of very quickly.

No more than half an hour later, Mizuru turns from watching Tiberius surf the internet and asks curiously, "I suppose you guys are off for those tests? ...Where exactly are you going, anyway?"

"We're going to my father's company building. There's a R&D lab inside that we'll be using for this." Rika answers to her anthro bat friend, and then adds, "Though there's a couple matters to take care of before that. Like getting Molly's medical records."

"The vet's kind of out of the way... I know! How about you three," Molly starts, gesturing towards Rika, Mizuru, and Kayla, "take care of what else you need to while Tom and I get my records? If you tell me what to look for, we can meet you at your dad's building. Sound good?"

"It's the large grey building near the center of town. Hard to miss. We should be there in a few hours from now if everything goes smoothly." Rika informs, stifling a giggle before she, Mizuru, and Kayla leave for the limo which drives off soon after.

As you and Molly go outside, you yell up into her face, "What were you THINKING?! We're miles from the vet and home! Walking the whole way will take forever!"

Molly narrows her icy blue eyes and smirks right back. "No it won't. Who said anything about you walking?" she remarks and then slowly begins to grow bigger. You back up and attempt to run, but Molly picks up the pace and takes two growing steps forward before lifting you off the ground in one hand. "Hey don't be running off... Hang on to my neck!" she tells you as she lifts you up to her neck, still growing. Seeing little choice, you cling to her neck for dear life as she starts running.

50 feet of gorgeous, anthropomorphic dog barrels through the city, being very careful where she places each step while somehow not losing any speed. Cars have little time to avoid each gigantic paw that comes down in front of them, but is gone before any can crash into them. "Excuse me! Sorry! In a hurry here! Eyes on the road, not at me!" she shouts to the traffic below her.

Finally, Molly reaches the vet clinic, lets you down, and then resumes her normal size. You think about berating her over her actions, but think better of it as you both go inside and take a seat. The doctor himself comes out in a minute and motions for you to come inside his office. "Ah, Tom! Here for Molly's medical records, right? ...Er, your friend there can take off the costume." he says.

"Not a costume, doc. And I'm doing very well, thank you!" Molly replies, almost enjoying the wide-eyed look she receives in return.

"We need the records to help us figure how this happened to her... and others like her." you explain.

The vet gives her a few basic tests like her blood pressure and weight ("479 lbs! I am a big girl...") before handing the records over. "I... I guess this is goodbye, doc. I hate to admit it, but I'm gonna miss coming here. Thanks... for everything." Molly says, sniffing and wiping a tear away before you and she exit.

"I didn't even know you could cry." you remark.

"Shut it. I'm sentimental. Now let's get going..." she responds curtly, before adding with her tongue sticking out, "...unless you'd like to walk the whole way there."

Molly once again grows to the terrifying size of 50 feet and lifts you to her neck. Once she feels you clinging on, she walks through the busier downtown area, maneuvering herself between the buildings as best as her curvy form allows. "Pardon me! Watch out! Yes, staring at my big boobs is so going to help you stay out of my way..." she shouts to those in her path, occasionally pausing to nudge a person or vehicle out of her way with her incoming paw.

Upon arrival, Molly rests her gigantic self against the side of the building, careful not to damage it, and taps the top floor and waves hello while she waits. Half an hour later, the Narumi family's limo pulls into the parking lot and the three passengers step out. "Welcome to NaruTech, guys!" Rika announces as Molly sets you down and returns to her normal size.

"Three more of them, huh? The other one's waiting just outside R&D lab 4." the receptionist says, trying to not appear frightened.

"Good. Father should be pleased she came, especially since... I totally forgot to invite her." the teen admits and then leads the group onward.

After more twists and turns than you can hope to keep track of, the group arrives before a huge metal door with a 4 printed on it. Breeze is sitting nearby patiently, seemingly oblivious to the stares she gets from many male employees. "Peter and I were in town to get some lumber when we remembered you needed my records, so I came over to deliver them." the mare explains.

Just then, Kosei Narumi appears out of the nearby elevator. "Welcome! You must be the one Mizuru referred to the other day. I'm Kosei Narumi." he introduces himself, giving a bow and holding out his hand.

"I'm Breeze. Pleasure to meet you!" Breeze replies as she stands up to return the shake and bow, unintentionally giving him a view of her cavernous cleavage.

Kosei blushes and clears his throat before finding a distraction in Kayla, asking, "Oh? And you are?"

Rika informs her father of everything that transpired today, and her thoughts that Kayla might provide some needed insight. Kayla herself looks on nervously, fiddling with the shoulder straps of her green top. "I'm willing to do what it takes to help stop these guys, s-sir." she says finally.

"I'm angered that you tried to hurt my Rika... but at the same time, I recognize that you're not at fault, and greatly appreciate your cooperation." he responds and adds, "Very well, let us be underway with the tests. Hopefully, we can find some answers."
1532121211121121112112211.title: Testing... and other matters.

choices: It's decided to try to figure out the device now.
Everyone wants to go home for the day.
15321212111211211121122111.content:
The huge metal doors of the lab open and Kosei enters followed by Rika and Mizuru, then Breeze, yourself, Molly, and finally Kayla. The shark anthro's tail is barely past the doorway before it quickly slides shut behind her, causing her to practically jump ten feet in the air with a surprised yelp. "My apologies, the timing of the door will need adjusting to account for tails in the near future." Kosei says apologetically.

"N-no problem..." Kayla replies, looking as though she's starting to have second thoughts about agreeing to all this. She gulps and attempts to look braver. You guess that she feels if she were to bail out now, she'd never be trusted, which probably isn't far from the truth.

"I know I took samples from you earlier, Breeze, Molly, but we'd like to take another if that's alright." Rika asks, withdrawing a syringe from the desk. Both nod and hold out their arm to let her draw some blood, again with some difficulty from their skin. Kayla visibly shakes as she seems to perceive something none of the others do.

"I-I'm fine... just a little hungry all of the sudden." Kayla states, and then adds defensively in regard to the stares, "I'm a shark, okay? I get hungry when I smell blood."

"You can have something to eat after we finish the tests. The doctor I hired to perform the tests should be here momentarily." Kosei informs.

Indeed, the door slides open and a man of about 30 enters the room wearing a lab coat and gloves. "Alright, what is it I'm to be working... on..." the man trails off as he notices the quartet of anthros in the room. "...Oh. Oh my..." Almost unconsciously, he messes with his tie and tries to seem as professional as possible without wetting himself.

"Why are you trying to straighten out your tie and coat?" Kayla asks him inquisitively, causing him to snap out of it.

"Oh! Um... no reason..." he answers, backing away a bit from the slightly taller anthro.

"Just running some tests on the blood samples of the taller two, Molly and Breeze." Kosei says.

"That's it? I don't think that will take too long, just let the machine do most of the work..."

"And..." Kayla gulps, again trying to swallow her nerves, "some more advanced tests on me. Something in me might provide valuable insight, and we'd like to know what it is..."

"We've got Molly and Breeze's medical records for a comparison." you add.

"Er, very well then. Forgive me if I'm stumbling on myself here, this is the first time I've had to deal with these... anthros." the man immediately gets to work, taking the samples and placing them in a special machine he brought with him. He examines a bit of the blood through a provided microscope. "There seems to be an awful lot of white blood cells here... They seem normal enough though." he notes. Soon enough, the DNA tests are ready and he takes his time to study them. "Okay, this is interesting... and weird."

"What is it?" Mizuru asks, her green eyes clearly trying to read the results herself.

"Their DNA is downright alien. It's like something removed sequences responsible for certain traits, and put superhuman-like ones in their place. This can't possibly be natural. DNA doesn't suddenly radically change like this, and certainly not so consistently across very different animal species." the doctor explains.

"Something out there created us deliberately. But why? How?" Breeze finishes for him, taking a moment to brush her mane of white hair out of her eyes as she looks down in thought.

"I have no idea... At any rate, I guess you're up... um, what's your name?" he asks Kayla.

"Kayla. Is this going to hurt?"

"I hope not, but I can't guarantee it'll be painless." he says, and then turns to everyone else. "I'm sorry, but it would be better if you step outside for this. I'll let you know when it's safe to come back in and we can discuss whatever I find."

You and everyone else comply and exit the lab, the metal doors sliding closed after. It's nerve-wracking, but what else can be done? Kosei guides you, Molly, Breeze, and Mizuru to the side wall before Rika pushes a button near the wall. The once seemingly opaque wall suddenly becomes clear and you can see and hear the procedure going on. "Alright, Kayla, just lie down on the table as best as you can. This... hm, this mask won't do. I'm sorry, but I'll have to give you an injection instead... Kayla?"

Upon laying on her back, Kayla seems to... almost zone out. It's the most peaceful you've seen the shark anthro. "...Yes? That's fine, but will it leave me paralyzed for a bit?" she asks, and the doctor nods. "Good... then there's no way I can possibly hurt you." she remarks with a grin as he injects her with a sedative, after some difficulty getting the needle in.

Shortly after Kayla's amber eyes close, the doctor gets to work cutting into her head. "There seems to be indications of blunt force trauma to the back of her head... Skull appears to be bone rather than cartilage, and something has cut into the cranial cavity some time ago." he notes, dabbing away a bit of her blood. Taking a tiny saw-like tool, he gradually cuts into her skull until he can remove it carefully. "The anthro's brain appears to have a highly developed cerebral cortex, not unlike a human's. Fascinating. Should the opportunity arise, I'll see about studying a deceased individual..."

"Might be waiting awhile..." Mizuru mutters upon hearing the doctor.

"Hence the 'should the opportunity arise' part, miss." the doctor replies over the two-way speaker, then moves on to the back of Kayla's head. "What the... what is this thing doing around the cerebellum?" he asks as he removes something from her head and proceeds to close her head back up.

A few moments later, the all clear is given and everyone reenters the lab. "So, what did you find? Will she be alright?" you ask curiously.

"Kayla will make a full recovery. The paralysis should leave her system soon. I found this device in her head. It appears to be designed to control voluntary muscle movement, possibly blocking neural signals it doesn't send itself. It's damaged, and appeared to be connected to something I couldn't get to in her head, but..."

"With that working in her head... she'd be effectively unable to control herself. Like a puppet on a string." Molly remarks with realization.

"I can still hear you guys over there..." you hear Kayla speak. Turning your head, you see the silvery blue haired shark getting up off the table.

"Oh, you poor thing!" Breeze cries out with sympathy, and unable to help herself, runs over and binds Kayla in a tight embrace.

"Thanks... for the sympathy, B-Breeze... Didn't we... agree on... a warning for this?" Kayla says, struggling for breath between the air being squeezed out of her like some squeaky toy and the face full of barely-contained boobage.
15321212111211211121122111.title: Discoveries

choices: You wake up to a seemingly normal day.
153212121112112111211221112.content:
After letting it be for a minute or so, Molly loudly clears her throat to get Breeze's attention, and the mare releases Kayla before she potentially unintentionally suffocates the shark. Upon her freedom, Kayla greedily gulps down air for half a minute as though it were the most wonderful thing in the world. You're still not quite certain how it is she breathes, but you assume one such human-like trait she has is having lungs instead of gills. "Whew... Well then, if that's everything needed from me... I'd... I'd like what was promised me. This lab reeks of blood, a good part of it my own, and now my stomach's convinced I'm starving..." Kayla says, her timidness returning almost in full force.

"Well, I don't think there's anything else at this time, aside from maybe an X-ray or two which I don't have the equipment here to do anyhow." the doctor admits.

"That's fine, doctor. I'll be sure my secretary sends the money to your account right away." Kosei informs him, and then calls his secretary. "Kris, can you make sure Dr. Waters receives the money we had agreed upon?" Wait - Kris? "This device may yield some vital information, but I feel it would be best to examine it after the lab has been decontaminated so we have as much of a controlled environment as possible." he mentions after as everyone exits the lab.

"But if it was inside my head, then I don't think the current mess will affect-" Kayla starts before Rika places her hand over the shark anthro's mouth to silence her.

"How about we make this just a little more clear... The device can wait until tomorrow, and the lab needs to be cleaned and decontaminated for safety reasons anyway. Are we clear?" Rika tells Kayla. The shark places her hand over the teen's and easily lifts it away just a bit, then nods her understanding. "Good. Now, let's get some dinner." she smiles and lets her hand down.

"Ooh! Good idea! Anyone mind me coming along?" an all-to-familiar voice asks. You turn around to see Kris... more dressed up than you've seen her before.

"Of course not. One last thing, however. Can you place this device somewhere safe? I fear it would be unwise to leave it out in the open, especially with the decontamination crew coming in." Kosei asks.

"Not a problem." Kris responds, and then puts on a pair of latex gloves before gently picking up the device from Kayla's head and walking away out of sight. She returns empty handed about a minute later, taking the gloves off and washing her hands. "Oh, and Dr. Waters? The money Mr. Narumi had agreed to pay for your services should show up in your account within the next 24 hours." she informs the doctor on his way out.

Soon, arrangements of who is to travel with who to the restaurant are made. The Narumis, Mizuru, and Kayla take the limo while you, Breeze, Molly, and Kris take her truck. "Are you certain you wish for me to travel with you?" Breeze asks with uncertainty.

"And I could just walk there myself..." Molly adds.

Kris pauses for a moment, no doubt thinking about how Molly would get there, and then replies, "Molly, it's getting dark. Please, both of you just get in my truck. There's enough room for both of you. Molly's getting shotgun."

Once outside, Molly has little choice but to concede on Kris' point. The four of you reach Kris' blue truck where she unlocks the doors. Molly gets in the front passenger seat while you and Breeze occupy the back seats. The mare's long legs are pressed up somewhat uncomfortably behind the driver's seat, yet not a peep of complaint comes out of her mouth. Kris gets in and starts the truck, driving it out of the back parking lot for employees.

"So, since when were you the secretary?" you ask along the way, never thinking your childhood friend would be able to sit long enough for the job.

"Dude. I've had the job for weeks now! My friend had it before me, but she left when it just wasn't working out for her. She recommended me for it and I took the job." Kris responds, and then adds, "I see though that you've gotten Mr. Narumi acquainted with Mizuru. That's awesome!"

Eventually, Kris pulls in to the restaurant's parking lot and finds a spot for her truck. Molly exits and happily stretches, as evidenced from her raised tail. Breeze gets out and rubs her knees and shins that had been pressed against the back of the driver seat. Still, the busty, almost ghostly in the low light of the evening mare appears to be pleased to be here.

Upon entry, the person who seats the customers approaches your group and automatically takes you to where the others are seated. There's a ton of stares from people towards both the non-humans already seated at the table and especially the ones just joining. And somehow every last stare of attraction, envy, and/or jealousy towards Breeze goes completely over the white mare's head. Molly on the other hand notices the stares in her direction and tries to just ignore it, though is far less successful than Breeze.

Soon, everyone makes their meal selections, with Kayla taking the longest to decide aside from steering clear of the choice of shark fin soup. ("People actually cut off shark fins... and put them into soup? That's... barbaric!") Breeze orders herself a salad and replies to the questioning stares at the table, "I don't particularly care for meat."

The meals come some time later, and everyone begins to dig in. At first, Kayla seems to do so a little too enthusiastically, but then quickly catches Rika and Mizuru's disapproving stares. "Sorry..." she apologizes meekly with a reddish tint to her grey cheeks strongly hinting at her blushing, and rapidly begins to get the hang of using a knife and fork. By the time everyone finishes, you could hardly tell that the shark anthro had never used them before.

The bills come a few minutes later, and you look at yours with wide eyes. The price is a lot higher than you're used to paying to eat out, and while you could have let either Kosei or Kris pay, you didn't want to burden them when you can pay for yourself.

Once everyone is outside, Kayla says, "That was the best thing I've ever eaten at least since I became an anthro! Thank you, both for the meal and... eheh... putting up with my poor manners earlier..."

Everyone returns to the vehicles they took to the restaurant and begin heading home. It takes the better part of half an hour, but soon you're returned to your house and both you and Molly exit Kris' truck. "I've got the day off tomorrow, so I'll probably be over at the sanctuary. Breeze will stay with me tonight, and I'll call this Peter fellow to let him know." Kris tells you.

"Er, shouldn't I just be taken home?" Breeze asks worriedly as she gets out to seat herself in the front passenger seat.

"Oh, don't worry about it! I don't mind having you over for the night, really!" Kris insists.

"O-okay then..." is the mare's still unsure reply.

You and Molly enter your house just as they leave. Tiredly, you say goodnight to her and get ready for bed, falling asleep as soon as your head hits the pillow.
153212121112112111211221112.title: Dinner, and a trip home.

1532121211121121112112211121.content:
The next day, you're fast asleep until you begin feeling someone poking you. "...up... get up..." your brain sluggishly registers being said to you.

"Five more minutes..." you groggily reply.

There's a silence, before a slightly annoyed growl which is then followed by heavy footsteps heading for the foot of your bed. Then, a fuzzy hand brushes against your feet... before everything suddenly starts feeling cold. Startled, you open your eyes and find Molly having pulled off the bed sheets, it still hanging from her hand. "Good almost afternoon, sleepyhead! I trust I don't need to do anything else to convince you to get up?" the 8'6" anthro says, wearing a huge grin on her face and wagging her bushy tail.

Grumpy, you comply and get out of bed. "Fine. Now unless you intend to take complete advantage of me while I get dressed, I'd like a little privacy." you tell her... though having sex with her does sound rather appealing. However, the busty dog shakes her head and ducks out the door... still carrying your bed sheets off with her. Ever the clever bitch, in the nicest way of course.

Once showered and dressed, you head into the kitchen for some breakfast. The clock on the wall has its hour hand between 11 and 12, while the minute hand is currently hovering over the 6... Better call it brunch, then. Quickly, you whip up some brunch and then devour it to quell your grumbling stomach. Since Molly didn't join or even poke her not-so-little head in, you assume she's already had something.

You're suddenly left breathless when Molly's large, toned arms wrap around your torso and pull you against the back of your chair. Once she lets go, you turn and ask, "What was that for? Could have nearly choked me!"

"Please. I was barely squeezing you! And that was for everything! What, I'm not allowed to show some affection and gratitude?" Molly answers, waiving your concern. She then leans down to your ear with narrowed eyes and adds with a smirk, "Or would you rather that in bed? Don't think that's healthy, good sir."

You begin to realize she's probably going to have fun tormenting you on what you had said earlier... "N-no, this is good just as is... I don't think I'm ready to have a 479 lb girl grinding my pelvic bones to jello..."

"Me neither. As in, I don't think you're ready."

Feeling a little awkward, you decide to just drop it entirely. You turn your computer on and check your email. A few pieces of spam, and a message from Ryan. "Hey man. Heard from Kris the anthros will be starting work at NaruTech today. Not all just yet, supposedly they want to slowly introduce them and see if they make a good fit, but that's kind of cool. I think I'll be swinging by the Sanctuary today to say hi to whoever is still there. P.S. say hi to Molly for me, and a scratch behind the ears. You know she deserves it, putting up with you.:p" Interesting, though there's still that device that came out of Kayla's head...

"You read the man. Now, where's my ear scratch?" Molly says with delight over your shoulder.

Figures she'd be reading your email over your shoulder. You're not even going to protest at this point. "Soon as you crouch down, girl. I'm not breaking out the step-ladder to reach 'em."

The tall, busty dog anthro crouches down almost immediately. Her icy blue eyes close with content as you scratch just behind her reddish brown ears, your hand pushing aside her red hair as you do. For as much as she can make herself... more than a handful these days, you can hardly imagine life without this amazon in it, whatever the reason she and others like her exist.

Eventually you stop, your hand starting to cramp slightly, and Molly opens her eyes. "That felt so nice... So, shall we pay the Sanctuary a visit? I'm kind of curious to find out how Breeze fared last night with Kris. God I hope she didn't corrupt the poor mare's mind..."

You think about the tall, busty white mare named Breeze. A walking wet dream of a body with a fine coat that hides very little of her ample curves, yet seems so utterly oblivious to the stares she receives. Or is she really that oblivious to the effect she has, and simply doesn't care that much? "I think she's safe. Actually, I'm a bit more worried about Kayla being influenced by Ryan." you voice your opinions, and then say in response to the Sanctuary, "Sure. Let's go."

Taking your keys, you and Molly head outside. You head for your car, but Molly says, "Seriously? You want to take your cramped car, when you and I both know what I can do?"

"Huh. And you worry about Breeze's mind being corrupted, when I have to wonder if you haven't let this go straight to your head..." you say teasingly as you put your keys away and wait for Molly to get up to size. It still amazes you how she can do this, and so fluidly. Soon, her head is level with the roof, and still she keeps adding mass to herself. She reaches her previous biggest size of 50 feet and stops at it, though you have your doubts that she has even approached her limit yet. You climb into her enormous, outstretched hand, and then she begins to make her way to the Sanctuary through the city as carefully as she can.

Yesterday's weather had been... Less than good.

Trudging through the mud that had formerly been soil, you sigh. At least it would be worth it when you got to the stables. Breeze always seemed to make your day better, no matter what had fortune may have befallen you.

Smiling as you finally arrive at the stable, you unlock the door and step inside, stamping to clear the mud off your boots. Closing the door behind you, you walk through the stable. Several year ago, you'd owned quite a few horses, but you couldn't afford to keep them all, and had been forced to sell them, one by one, until only Breeze remained.

You weren't going to sell Breeze. Not now, not ever.

What had been the names of your other horses? Ah, yes: Maximus, Phaedra, Billy, and Biscuit. You only hoped that they were being treated well by their masters.

Stopping outside Breeze's door, you flick the light switch for her stable, and hear the pure white mare shuffle about inside as the lights come on. Smiling, you push the door open, and see...

Breeze. But not as you recognised her.

Breeze's formerly equine body had been twisted and reshaped into an approximation of a human's body, but she had kept her horse head, her tail, and her legs still ended in hooves. A pair of massive breasts adorned her chest, the two furred globes reaching down to her smooth stomach. Her wide hips obscured a perfectly round ass that would easily spill over the sides of your lap if she sat on you.

And, last but not least, was her height. You yourself were average height at six foot even, but Breeze loomed far above you at a whopping seven foot and a half, her head a mere six inches from the ceiling.

Realising that you had been staring at Breeze's magnificent body, you turn your gaze downward as the equine takes a tentative step forward.

What happens next?

Breeze slowly rises higher and higher, her moans growing increasingly louder as she expands. Sitting flat on her arse, Breeze was chin height to you - then your height - and then taller than you! God, what are we going to do? I don't know if I'll be able to feed you if you're this big, and you'll have to sleep outside in the cold, and- and-"

You suddenly find a fair portion of your mouth covered by one of Breeze's large, slender fingers. Looking up into Breeze's huge blue eyes, you can't help but feel truly small. She was at least twice as tall as you, and most likely had a fair bit of size on top of that!

Try as you might, you just can't link up your hands behind Breeze's back - her torso has grown so large, and her breasts have enlargened so much that you can't manage it.
